entries: You can take a {@action Magic|XPHB} action to cause your lantern to illuminate with a vibrant maroon light, which sheds {@variantrule Bright Light|XPHB} in a 10-foot radius and {@variantrule Dim Light|XPHB} for an additional 10 feet. {@condition Invisible|XPHB} creatures and objects are visible while they are in the lantern's {@variantrule Bright Light|XPHB}. The lantern sheds light in this way for 1 hour or until you end the effect early as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}.
Once you use this feature, you can't do so again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Dangerous Tool
entries: Your {@subclassFeature Illuminating Aura|Warlock|XPHB|Lantern|ObojimaTallGrass24|3|ObojimaTallGrass24} no longer ends if you let go of your lantern. While you aren't holding your lantern, you can magically take control of it for 1 minute (no action required), using it as if it were a {@spell Spiritual Weapon} (cast as a level 2 spell), without requiring your {@status Concentration|XPHB}. Your lantern continues to act as your {@variantrule Spellcasting Focus|XPHB} while using this feature, even though you are no longer holding it.
The level at which Spiritual Weapon is considered to be cast increases when you reach Warlock levels 10 (level 3 spell) and 14 (level 4 spell).
Once you take control of your lantern in this way, you can't do so again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, unless you expend a Pact Magic spell slot to take control of it again.

subclassFeature.name: Oracle Illumination
entries: You can take a {@action Magic|XPHB} action to connect your mind to a light source (such as a candle or torch) that you can see or are familiar with. The light source functions like the sensor created by the {@spell Clairvoyance|XPHB} spell, granting you the same benefits. You can use the light source in this way for 10 minutes or until you use this feature again.
Once you use this feature on a light source, you can't use it on the same light source again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Brilliant Illumination
entries: While your lantern's {@subclassFeature Illuminating Aura|Warlock|XPHB|Lantern|ObojimaTallGrass24|3|ObojimaTallGrass24} is active, you can take a {@action Magic|XPHB} action to cause the light to flare with an overwhelmingly brilliant flash. Each creature other than you illuminated by either your lantern's {@variantrule Bright Light|XPHB} or {@variantrule Dim Light|XPHB} (your choice) must make a Constitution saving throw against your Warlock spell save DC. On a failed save, a creature takes Radiant damage equal to {@dice 2d8} plus your Warlock level and has the {@condition Blinded|XPHB} condition until the end of your next turn. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage only.
Once you use this feature, you can't do so again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Brighter Still
entries: You gain the ability to activate your lantern's {@subclassFeature Illuminating Aura|Warlock|XPHB|Lantern|ObojimaTallGrass24|3|ObojimaTallGrass24} at will. Features such as {@subclassFeature Dangerous Tool|Warlock|XPHB|Lantern|6|6ObojimaTallGrass24} and {@subclassFeature Brilliant Illumination|Warlock|XPHB|Lantern|ObojimaTallGrass24|10|ObojimaTallGrass24} that work in conjunction with Illuminating Aura are still limited to the number of uses described in their respective features.

Additionally, while holding your lantern, you can take a {@action Magic|XPHB} action to cause it to illuminate with a pale blue light. Doing so reveals a glowing arcane path to a location you're familiar with, as if you cast the {@spell Find the Path|XPHB} spell.
Once you use your lantern in this way, you can't do so again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Origami Mage
entries: Origami Mages are wielders of a unique form of magic that combines precision, creativity, and imagination. With a flick of the wrist and a whisper of arcane words, they transform simple sheets of paper into awe-inspiring manifestations of elemental forces, mystical beings, and fantastical creatures.

Drawing inspiration from the mysterious elegance of origami, these mages are not bound by traditional spell components but instead rely on the meticulous manipulation of paper to channel their magical energies. Origami magic is not without its challenges. Mastery of this arcane discipline demands patience, dexterity, and a keen eye for detail. Each fold must be precise, each crease exact—for even the smallest imperfection can disrupt the flow of magic and render a spell ineffective. Yet for those who persevere, the rewards are boundless.

subclassFeature.name: An Arcane Art
entries: You learn to weave magic into origami, allowing you to create magnificent moving art pieces that act on your behalf. As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can fold and imbue life into a piece of paper that takes a form you choose from the "Origami Constructs" section below. When crafted, an Origami Construct becomes bound to you or to another creature of your choice that you can see within 60 feet of you (your choice).

A creature with a bound Origami Construct gains the unique effects and benefits listed for that Construct. A creature can't have more than one of the same Origami Construct bound to it at a time, unless stated otherwise. A bound Origami Construct occupies the same space as the creature it's bound to.

These Constructs remain imbued with life for a number of hours equal to half your Wizard level (round up). Origami Constructs are objects with an AC equal to your Wizard spell save DC. They have {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB} to Poison and Psychic damage, and they are destroyed when they take any damage. You can use this feature to create an Origami Construct a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of once). You regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

entries.name: Origami Constructs
entries: The Origami Constructs are presented in alphabetical order.

entries.name: Bird
entries: While the origami bird is bound to a creature, that creature gains proficiency in the {@skill Perception|XPHB} skill. Additionally, the creature deals an extra 2 Slashing damage whenever it hits a target with a ranged attack.

entries.name: Cat
entries: While the origami cat is bound to a creature, that creature gains proficiency in the {@skill Stealth|XPHB} skill. Additionally, once on each of the creature's turns when it hits a target with a melee attack roll using a weapon or an {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB}, the origami cat can make a melee spell attack against the same target. The origami cat's attack modifier is equal to the bound creature's weapon attack modifier, and on a hit, the target takes {@damage 1d6} Slashing damage.
The origami cat's damage increases when the Wizard that crafted it reaches levels 5 ({@dice 1d8}), 11 ({@dice 1d10}), and 17 ({@dice 1d12}).

entries.name: Crab
entries: While the origami crab is bound to a creature, that creature gains a +1 bonus to AC and proficiency in the {@skill Athletics|XPHB} skill. If the Wizard who crafted this origami crab creates another, this origami crab is destroyed.

entries.name: Dragon
entries: While the origami dragon is bound to a creature, that creature has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth|XPHB}) checks and can't benefit from the {@condition Invisible|XPHB} condition. Additionally, the creature takes {@damage 1d4} Fire damage at the start of each of its turns. A creature can have multiple origami dragons bound to it at the same time.
When the origami dragon is destroyed, it quickly pops in an audible explosion, dealing {@damage 2d6} Fire damage to each creature within 5 feet of it.

entries.name: Frog
entries: While the origami frog is bound to a creature, that creature gains proficiency in the {@skill Acrobatics|XPHB} skill. Additionally, when the creature would fail a Dexterity saving throw, it can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to add a bonus to the roll equal to the Intelligence modifier of the Wizard that crafted the origami frog (minimum of +1); using this effect destroys the origami frog.

subclassFeature.name: Origami Familiar
entries: You always have the {@spell Find Familiar|XPHB} spell prepared. Your familiar appears as an origami version of itself. It has {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB} to Poison and Psychic damage as well as the {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} condition, and it is a Construct instead of a Celestial, Fey, or Fiend. In addition to the familiar's normal statistics, it also gains access to the following abilities:

entries.name: Camouflage
entries: You can command your origami familiar to shift into a flattened paper form. In this form, the familiar looks nearly indistinguishable from a normal piece of paper. A creature that takes a {@action Study|XPHB} action to examine the familiar can discern that it is a creature with a successful Intelligence ({@skill Investigation|XPHB}) check against your Wizard spell save DC. The familiar can take a {@action Magic|XPHB} action to shift back into its origami form.

entries.name: Last Resort
entries: As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, your origami familiar can dive toward a creature, unfurling itself and wrapping around the target's face like a sheet of paper blown by the wind. The target must make a Dexterity saving throw against your Wizard spell save DC or have the {@condition Blinded|XPHB} condition for 1 minute. The target or another creature within 5 feet of it can take an action to make a Strength ({@skill Athletics|XPHB}) check against your Wizard spell save DC.
On a success, the familiar is removed, and the target no longer has the {@condition Blinded|XPHB} condition. When this effect ends, the familiar is destroyed.

entries.name: Reconnaissance
entries: As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can command your origami familiar to spy. The familiar then spends 1 minute listening to any and all sounds within 15 feet of itself, recording what it overhears on its paper body. It then returns to you and becomes an inert piece of paper, leaving behind a transcript of its findings written in a language of your choice that you know.

subclassFeature.name: Binding Release
entries: You can take a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to move one of your {@subclassFeature An Arcane Art|Wizard|XPHB|Origami Mage|ObojimaTallGrass24|3|ObojimaTallGrass24|Origami Constructs} to a creature that you can see within 30 feet of it.

subclassFeature.name: Paper Path
entries: When you cast a {@filter spell with a range of Touch|spells|source=|class=wizard|components & miscellaneous=|range=touch} and your {@subclassFeature Origami Familiar|Wizard|XPHB|Origami Mage|ObojimaTallGrass24|3|ObojimaTallGrass24|Origami Familiar} delivers the touch, it no longer requires the familiar's {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Origami Servant
entries: You always have the {@spell Unseen Servant|XPHB} spell prepared. In addition, you can cast it without expending a spell slot, but the maximum number of servants you can have at a time is equal to half your Wizard level (round up). When you cast it, it has the following changes:

items: The spell lasts for a number of hours equal to 1 plus your Intelligence modifier (minimum of 2 hours), instead of 1 hour.
Your servant appears as a visible origami version of itself.
Your servant has {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB} to Poison and Psychic damage as well as the {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} condition.
Your servant can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch without expending extra movement to do so.
When you take a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to command a servant, you can issue a unique command to each servant you have created as part of the same {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}.
Your servant falls at a rate of 60 feet per round and takes no damage from falling.
Your servant can see {@condition Invisible|XPHB} creatures and objects as if they were visible.

As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action while your servant is within 200 feet of you, you can see through its eyes and hear what it hears until the start of your next turn, gaining the benefits of any special senses it has.
You can command your servant to perform a task that would move it up to 200 feet away from you, instead of 60 feet.

subclassFeature.name: Arcane Refresh
entries: Whenever one of your {@subclassFeature An Arcane Art|Wizard|XPHB|Origami Mage|ObojimaTallGrass24|3|ObojimaTallGrass24|Origami Constructs} is destroyed, the magic you lent it returns to you. You either regain 10 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} or one expended spell slot of level 2 or lower (your choice).

Additionally, when one of your Origami Constructs you can see would take damage, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to negate that damage. Once you use this ability, you can't do so again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Demon
entries: While wearing this mask, you gain the following benefits:

items.name: Arcane Memory
items.entry: As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can expend a spell slot to magically learn whether a creature or object you specify has been within 20 feet of your current location in the past 24 hours. If you expend a spell slot of level 3 or higher, you receive a brief vision of the creature or object while it was there, and you learn the exact time it was present.

items.name: Demon Eye
items.entry: As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you gain the ability to see through solid objects out to a range of 15 feet. This vision is blocked by 1 foot of stone, dirt, or wood; 1 inch of metal; or a thin sheet of lead.

optionalfeature.name: Fish
entries: While wearing this mask, you gain a {@variantrule Swim Speed|XPHB} equal to your {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} and the ability to breathe underwater. Additionally, you always have the {@spell Water Bullet|ObojimaTallGrass24} and {@spell Whelm Weapon|ObojimaTallGrass24} spells prepared.

optionalfeature.name: Fox
entries: While wearing this mask, you can move through an enemy's space (regardless of its size), and that enemy's space isn't {@variantrule Difficult Terrain|XPHB} for you. Additionally, your AC increases by 1, and when you make a Dexterity saving throw, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to gain {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on the roll.

optionalfeature.name: Golem
entries: While wearing this mask, your attacks with weapons and {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB|Unarmed Strikes} deal an extra {@damage 1d8} damage on a hit, and the {@itemProperty H|XPHB|Heavy} property doesn't impose {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on your attack rolls with {@filter Heavy weapons|items|source=|type=|property=heavy|category=|miscellaneous=}, even if your Strength or Dexterity score is less than 13. In addition, your attacks and spells deal double damage to objects and structures.

optionalfeature.name: Harpy
entries: While wearing this mask, you have a {@variantrule Fly Speed|XPHB} equal to your {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} and {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Psychic damage.

optionalfeature.name: Old Man
entries: While wearing this mask, you always have the {@spell Detect Magic} and {@spell Identify} spells prepared, and you can cast them without expending a spell slot or Material components.

optionalfeature.name: Protagonist
entries: When you roll {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB} while wearing this mask, you gain {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} equal to half your Bard level (round up). Additionally, you can take a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to mark a creature as your antagonist for 1 minute. For the duration, you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on ability checks involving your antagonist. When you see your antagonist make an attack roll—but before the GM says whether the attack hits or misses—you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to expend a use of {@classFeature Bardic Inspiration|Bard|XPHB|1}; roll your Bardic Inspiration die and subtract the number rolled from your antagonist's attack roll.

optionalfeature.name: Sea Urchin
entries: While wearing this mask, you can take a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} and expend a use of {@classFeature Bardic Inspiration|Bard|XPHB|1}, rolling a Bardic Inspiration die. You regain a number of {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to the number rolled plus half your Bard level (round up).

Additionally, you can take a {@action Magic|XPHB} action to attempt to immobilize a creature you can see within 30 feet of you, injecting it with magical toxins. The target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or have the {@condition Restrained|XPHB} condition for 1 minute. The target repeats the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. You can use this ability a number of times equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of once). You regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Spirit
entries: While wearing this mask, you always have the {@spell Speak with Dead|XPHB} spell prepared. Additionally, you can expend a use of {@classFeature Bardic Inspiration|Bard|XPHB|1} to temporarily move through the Spirit Realm. When you move in this way, you step through the veil into the Spirit Realm where it overlaps with your current plane.

While in the Spirit Realm, you can affect and be affected only by creatures, objects, and effects on that plane. Creatures that aren't in the Spirit Realm can't perceive or interact with you unless a feature gives them the ability to do so. At the end of your turn or when you stop moving, you return to the plane you left in the spot that corresponds to your space in the Spirit Realm. If you appear in an occupied space, you are shunted to the nearest unoccupied space and take {@damage 1d10} Force damage.

optionalfeature.name: Stone
entries: While wearing this mask, you gain proficiency in the {@skill Athletics|XPHB} skill, and all Bludgeoning, Piercing, and Slashing damage you take is reduced by 2. Additionally, you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on ability checks and saving throws against effects that would push or pull you or cause you to have the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition.

optionalfeature.name: Ballooning Bag
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you cause a bag you are wearing or carrying (such as a backpack, canvas sack, fanny pack, or satchel) to rapidly inflate with air. The bag then floats upward, lifting you off the ground and carrying you up to 30 feet straight into the air. You hover in place there until you let go of the bag (no action required) or until the start of your next turn, at which point the bag gently floats back to the ground.
Alternatively, while you're falling, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to cause the bag to inflate, granting you the benefits of the {@spell Feather Fall|XPHB} spell.

optionalfeature.name: Entangling Cord
entries: When you take the {@action Attack|XPHB} action, you can choose to replace one of your attacks with an entangling strike. Choose an object that features tendril-like properties (such as a chain, extension cord, game controller, rope, or tape measure). The object must be on your person or within 30 feet of you, and you must be able to see it.

When you do so, the object springs to life, stretching out toward a creature you can see within 15 feet of it. Make a ranged attack using your Constitution modifier plus your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}. On a hit, the target is pulled up to 15 feet toward the object.

optionalfeature.name: Find the Thing
entries: As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you focus your energy through a navigational object you're touching (such as a compass, GPS device, or map). When you do so, you cast the {@spell Locate Object|XPHB} spell with the following changes:

items: It doesn't require {@status Concentration|XPHB}.
It has a duration of 1 hour.
It can detect an object within 1 mile of you, instead of 1,000 feet.

optionalfeature.name: First Age Steed
entries: You enact a ritual that creates a bond with a special vehicle of your choice that can't fly (such as a bicycle, moped, or similar object you can sit on). This vehicle can only carry one creature and has a {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} of 60 feet. As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can summon that vehicle to your side. While summoned, the vehicle has {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB} to all damage. It disappears in a puff of smoke after 1 hour.

optionalfeature.name: Goggled Vision
entries: While wearing an ocular covering (such as ski goggles, spectacles, sunglasses, or a welding mask), you can take a {@action Magic|XPHB} action to gain {@sense Darkvision|XPHB} with a range of 60 feet. Additionally, you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on Intelligence ({@skill Investigation|XPHB}) checks to determine whether something is an illusion. These effects on your covering last for 1 hour.

optionalfeature.name: Leaping Sneakers
entries: While wearing a pair of footwear (such as boots or shoes), you can take a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to add a spring to your step. For 1 hour, you gain the benefits of the {@spell Jump|XPHB} spell.

optionalfeature.name: Pocket Voice
entries: You can spend 1 minute enacting a ritual that binds your voice to an object you can see that looks as if it would produce a sound (such as a boombox, jewelry box, pair of headphones, portrait of a person, radio, or statue with a mouth). Your voice remains bound to the object for 1 hour or until you dismiss the effect as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}. While bound, everything you say can also be heard through the object, provided you're on the same plane of existence as it.

optionalfeature.name: Water Jettison
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you spray a misty stream of water from a container on your person (such as a soda can, spray bottle, squirt water bottle, or waterskin). When you do so, you gain the benefits of the {@action Disengage|XPHB} action and are pushed 10 feet in a direction of your choice.

optionalfeature.name: Blooming Light
entries: As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can spend 1 {@subclassFeature Wax Enchantments|Rogue|XPHB|Waxwork|ObojimaTallGrass24|3|ObojimaTallGrass24|Wick Point} to ignite a dark green candle, which burns in a similar hue for 1 hour. While lit, the candle sheds {@variantrule Dim Light|XPHB} in a 10-foot radius. Creatures in the candle's light are hidden from Divination magic and can't be targeted by such magic or perceived through magical scrying sensors.

optionalfeature.name: Bocha Glue Wax
entries: Bocha glue is a delicate mixture of the finest waxes available and a collection of ingredients known only to the Waxwork Rogues. When enchanted properly, it can temporarily hold any two objects together. As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can spend 1 {@subclassFeature Wax Enchantments|Rogue|XPHB|Waxwork|ObojimaTallGrass24|3|ObojimaTallGrass24|Wick Point} to create an adhesive bond between two objects using just a small amount of bocha glue. The two objects remain bound for 24 hours, after which the enchantment fades and they separate. A creature within reach of the objects can take a {@action Utilize|XPHB} action to make a {@dc 15} Strength ({@skill Athletics|XPHB}) check, breaking the bond early on a success.

optionalfeature.name: Burning Delay
entries: You can spend 3 additional {@subclassFeature Wax Enchantments|Rogue|XPHB|Waxwork|ObojimaTallGrass24|3|ObojimaTallGrass24|Wick Points} to simultaneously activate Burning Delay when you use one of the following enchantments: {@optfeature Candle Pop|ObojimaTallGrass24}, {@optfeature Fish Fat Candle|ObojimaTallGrass24}, or {@optfeature Detonate|ObojimaTallGrass24}. When you do so, you delay that enchantment's activation by 1 round, 1 minute, or 10 minutes (your choice).

optionalfeature.name: Candle Pop
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can spend 2 {@subclassFeature Wax Enchantments|Rogue|XPHB|Waxwork|ObojimaTallGrass24|3|ObojimaTallGrass24|Wick Points} to ignite a misshapen yellow candle and hurl it at a creature you can see within 60 feet of you. The target must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw against your {@classFeature Cunning Strike|Rogue|XPHB|5} DC or be partially encased in wax, causing the target to have the {@condition Restrained|XPHB} condition. At the end of each of its turns, the {@condition Restrained|XPHB} target repeats the save, ending the effect on itself on a success.

optionalfeature.name: Consuming Flame
entries: When you see an enemy within 60 feet of you casting a spell, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} and spend 3 {@subclassFeature Wax Enchantments|Rogue|XPHB|Waxwork|ObojimaTallGrass24|3|ObojimaTallGrass24|Wick Points} to momentarily ignite a thin white candle and cast {@spell Counterspell|XPHB}, using your {@classFeature Cunning Strike|Rogue|XPHB|5} DC. If the spell is successfully countered and was level 3 or lower, you can spend an additional 2 Wick Points to store the spell inside your candle.

While holding the candle, you can reignite it to cast the spell stored inside, using the spell's normal casting time. The spell uses the slot level, spell save DC, spell attack modifier, and spellcasting ability of the original caster, but is otherwise treated as if you cast the spell. Once the spell is cast, the candle is sundered and becomes unusable. A spell can be stored inside a candle for up to 24 hours, after which the spell fades and can no longer be used.

optionalfeature.name: Delicacy
entries: As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can spend 1 {@subclassFeature Wax Enchantments|Rogue|XPHB|Waxwork|ObojimaTallGrass24|3|ObojimaTallGrass24|Wick Point} to imbue the tart flavor of a pyramid melon and the healing properties of a river spirit into a candle. As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, a creature can consume the candle to regain {@dice 1d6} {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} and receive enough nourishment to sustain it for one day. A candle holds this enchantment for 24 hours, after which its benefits end. You can have no more than two candles with this enchantment at a time.

optionalfeature.name: Detonate
entries: As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can spend 3 or more {@subclassFeature Wax Enchantments|Rogue|XPHB|Waxwork|ObojimaTallGrass24|3|ObojimaTallGrass24|Wick Points} to ignite a dark black candle and throw it at a point you can see within 60 feet of you. Each creature in a 20-foot-radius {@variantrule Sphere [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Sphere} centered on that point must make a Dexterity saving throw against your {@classFeature Cunning Strike|Rogue|XPHB|5} DC, as a brilliant eruption of flame sweeps out from it. For 3 Wick Points, a target takes {@damage 2d6} Fire damage and {@damage 2d8} Thunder damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one. You can increase this enchantment's Fire damage by {@dice 1d6} for each additional Wick Point you spend. Flammable objects in the area that aren't being worn or carried start burning.

optionalfeature.name: Fish Fat Candle
entries: As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can spend 1 {@subclassFeature Wax Enchantments|Rogue|XPHB|Waxwork|ObojimaTallGrass24|3|ObojimaTallGrass24|Wick Point} to ignite an oily brick of blubber-infused candle wax and throw it at a point you can see on the ground within 60 feet of you. One round after the candle lands, it emits a cloud of colorful smoke that creates a {@variantrule Heavily Obscured|XPHB} area in a 20-foot radius centered on that point. The candle continues to spew smoke for 1 minute, creating a visible trail in the sky that can be seen from up to 10 miles away.

optionalfeature.name: Flooding Abundance
entries: As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can spend 2 {@subclassFeature Wax Enchantments|Rogue|XPHB|Waxwork|ObojimaTallGrass24|3|ObojimaTallGrass24|Wick Points} to ignite a tea light candle and throw it into an unoccupied space you can see on the ground within 60 feet of you. The candle melts rapidly, bubbling and boiling with an overwhelming amount of wax, which flows over and fills a 15-foot {@variantrule Cube [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Cube} centered on the candle. The wax remains for 1 minute, and its area is {@variantrule Difficult Terrain|XPHB}. It is flammable, and a 5-foot {@variantrule Cube [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Cube} of wax exposed to fire burns away in 3 rounds, dealing {@damage 2d6} Fire damage to any creature that starts its turn in the fire.

optionalfeature.name: Iron Seal
entries: As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can spend 1 {@subclassFeature Wax Enchantments|Rogue|XPHB|Waxwork|ObojimaTallGrass24|3|ObojimaTallGrass24|Wick Point} to melt and press the wax seal of iron onto a door or an object with a lid. Once imbued with your seal, the object becomes magically held shut and can't be opened unless a creature takes a {@action Utilize|XPHB} action to make a {@dc 15} Strength ({@skill Athletics|XPHB}) check, breaking the seal on a success. The Iron Seal lasts until it is broken or dispelled (as if it were a level 1 spell). You can take a {@action Magic|XPHB} action to touch one of your Iron Seals and end its effects early.

optionalfeature.name: Lost Wax Carving
entries: Using a lost form of wax carving, you can spend 2 {@subclassFeature Wax Enchantments|Rogue|XPHB|Waxwork|ObojimaTallGrass24|3|ObojimaTallGrass24|Wick Points} to craft a detailed replica of an object over the course of 10 minutes, producing the effects of the {@spell Duplicate|ObojimaTallGrass24} spell. The object you duplicate must be no larger than a 1-foot {@variantrule Cube [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Cube}.

optionalfeature.name: Maker's Mark
entries: Once on each of your turns, when you make an attack roll with a one-handed weapon as part of the {@action Attack|XPHB} action, you can spend 1 {@subclassFeature Wax Enchantments|Rogue|XPHB|Waxwork|ObojimaTallGrass24|3|ObojimaTallGrass24|Wick Point} to make an {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB} with your free hand as part of the same action, using one of your signet rings. This {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB} deals Bludgeoning damage equal to {@dice 1d4} plus your Dexterity modifier, plus an extra {@damage 1d6} Fire damage. This attack can benefit from your Sneak Attack, provided you haven't already used it this turn.

optionalfeature.name: Shielding Seal
entries: As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can spend 1 {@subclassFeature Wax Enchantments|Rogue|XPHB|Waxwork|ObojimaTallGrass24|3|ObojimaTallGrass24|Wick Point} to melt and press the wax seal of shielding onto a willing creature or an object, protecting it from incoming damage. The target gains 5 {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB}, which last for 24 hours. You can grant an additional 5 {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} for each additional Wick Point spent, to a maximum of 15 {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB}. You can have only one Shielding Seal active at a time. Creating a Shielding Seal while another seal of the same type is already active ends the effects of the initial one early.

optionalfeature.name: Spark Shower
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can spend 1 {@subclassFeature Wax Enchantments|Rogue|XPHB|Waxwork|ObojimaTallGrass24|3|ObojimaTallGrass24|Wick Point} to bring your free hand to your mouth, igniting your next breath. Your exhale creates a dazzling shower of sparks aimed at a creature within 5 feet of you. You have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on the next attack roll you make with a weapon or an {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB} against the target this turn, and the target can't make {@action Opportunity Attack|XPHB|Opportunity Attacks} until the end of the turn.

optionalfeature.name: Waxlings
entries: As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can spend 2 {@subclassFeature Wax Enchantments|Rogue|XPHB|Waxwork|ObojimaTallGrass24|3|ObojimaTallGrass24|Wick Points} to temporarily pull and trap a minor spirit within a candle, creating a Waxling. You cast the {@spell Find Familiar|XPHB} spell with the following changes:

items: In place of a normal familiar, you imbue life into the candle, causing it to grow appendages and eyes.
Your Waxling familiar uses the statistics of a {@creature Rat|XMM}.
You can command the familiar to take a {@action Magic|XPHB} action to touch a flammable object. The object starts burning if it isn't being worn or carried.
The familiar sheds {@variantrule Bright Light|XPHB} in a 5-foot radius and {@variantrule Dim Light|XPHB} for an additional 10 feet.
You can't temporarily dismiss the familiar.
The familiar is dismissed permanently after 1 hour or when it is reduced to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}.
You can have more than one of these familiars at a time.

optionalfeature.name: Wick Whip
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can spend 3 {@subclassFeature Wax Enchantments|Rogue|XPHB|Waxwork|ObojimaTallGrass24|3|ObojimaTallGrass24|Wick Points} to ignite a 10-foot length of candlewick that has soaked in the stomach acid of a {@creature dragon frog|ObojimaTallGrass24}. The flames burn at an intense heat that warps the air around them, shedding {@variantrule Bright Light|XPHB} in a 15-foot radius and {@variantrule Dim Light|XPHB} for an additional 15 feet. The candlewick burns for 1 minute, during which you can use it as a Melee weapon you're proficient with. It deals {@damage 3d4} Fire damage on a hit (add your ability modifier to the damage roll as normal), and it has the {@itemProperty F|XPHB|Finesse}, {@itemProperty L|XPHB|Light}, and {@itemProperty R|XPHB|Reach} properties.

spell.name: Armament
entries: Up to five simple or martial weapons of your choice materialize in an unoccupied space you can see within range. The weapons are nonmagical, but they are well made and stylistically look however you choose. The weapons vanish when the spell ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: You can summon three additional simple or martial weapons of your choice for each spell slot level above 1.

spell.name: At Your Side
entries: You and up to three other willing creatures of your choice within range form an arcane bond, which magically pulls you forward when moving toward each other. For the duration, each target's {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} increases by 5 feet. Additionally, whenever an affected creature ends its turn, all targets of the spell can use their {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to move up to half their {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} toward another affected creature.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: You can target one additional creature for each spell slot level above 2.

spell.name: Beast Transmutation
entries: This spell transforms a Beast you can see within range into a Humanoid form. An unwilling target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw to avoid the effect. The spell has no effect on a Beast with 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}.

The transformation lasts for the duration, or until the target drops to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} or dies. The new form has the appearance of a Humanoid of any species you choose. The target's game statistics are replaced by the statistics of a {@creature Commoner|XMM}, but it retains its creature type; {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}; {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB}; alignment; personality; and Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma scores.

The target gains 4 {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB}. These {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} vanish if any remain when the spell ends. The spell ends early on the target if it has no {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} left.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the spell's duration increases by 1 hour for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Bubble Lift
entries: You blow a bubble around any solid, granular, or liquid object that weighs 500 pounds or less, causing it to float 4 feet off the ground. No matter its contents, the bubble weighs 10 pounds and can be pushed using an action. Strong winds or effects that would push a creature also push the bubble. The bubble always floats at least 4 feet above the ground, and it descends from a fall at a rate of 10 feet per round.
When the spell ends, the bubble pops, releasing its contents. The spell ends early if a creature within reach takes an action to pierce the bubble.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: The amount of weight the bubble can lift increases by 500 pounds for each spell slot level above 1.

spell.name: Butterfly Storm
entries: You create a chaotic cloud of butterflies in a 20-foot-radius {@variantrule Sphere [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Sphere} centered on a point you can see within range. The area is {@variantrule Heavily Obscured|XPHB}, and any fog or smoke in the area is dispersed.

When you cast this spell, all creatures other than those you designate are subjected to the following effects. The affected area is {@variantrule Difficult Terrain|XPHB}. Any affected creature that attempts to leave the area must make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, it is pulled back to the unoccupied space closest to the center of the {@variantrule Sphere [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Sphere}.

spell.name: Conjure Ocean

components.m: a piece of Witch's eye coral

entries: You teleport a random 20-foot {@variantrule Cube [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Cube} of water from the bottom of the ocean to an area you can see within range. The water retains its shape as if held within a container. A creature can enter and exit the water as normal.
When the spell ends, the water loses its shape, crashing to the ground and spreading outward. Any creature inside the water when this happens is carried 30 feet in a random direction.

spell.name: Control Animal
entries: Choose a Beast that you can see within range. The Beast is affected if it has a {@variantrule Challenge Rating|XPHB} of 2 or lower; otherwise, the spell fails. An affected target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or you take total and precise control of it as your consciousness enters its body. While under the effect of this spell, you can see through the target's eyes and hear what it hears, gaining the benefits of any special senses the target has.

You can move and take actions as the target and can perform tasks the target could feasibly perform. For the duration, your body is considered to have the {@condition Unconscious|XPHB} condition; this doesn't affect your {@status Concentration|XPHB} on the spell, but if the target has the {@condition Unconscious|XPHB} condition or dies, the spell ends. If the target takes damage, you must make a Wisdom ({@skill Animal Handling|XPHB}) check, with a DC equal to 10 or half the damage it took (round down), whichever number is higher. On a failure, the target regains control of its body, and the spell ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: The maximum {@variantrule Challenge Rating|XPHB} affected by this spell increases by 1 for each spell slot level above 2.

spell.name: Counterspy

components.m: a bag of sand and six candles

entries: You create an intricate arcane circle of candles and sand, centered on a point on the ground within range. The circle can have a radius of up to 10 feet. If, at any point before the spell ends, a creature outside the circle can see or hear you through magical or nonmagical means, the candles' flames change color. If a spell or other magical effect was used, you are aware of it and understand the extent of its effects.

spell.name: Create Spirit Train Stop

m.text: a blank ticket and high quality ink worth at least 50 gp, which the spell consumes

entries: As you cast the spell, you inscribe onto your blank ticket the code of a {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB|Hit Dice} train stop of your choice whose stop number you're already familiar with. A shimmering sign and small bench appear behind you as the Wandering Line arrives on tracks that materialize before it. Your ticket grants passage for you and up to nine other creatures of your choice. It takes 1 hour to arrive at your destination, regardless of the distance.

During your travel, other stops may occur and are determined by the GM. If a target takes a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB} while traveling and regains {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} at the end of the {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB} by spending one or more {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB|Hit Dice}, it regains an additional {@dice 1d10} {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}.

There are countless train stops, each with a unique train stop number. When you first gain the ability to cast this spell, you learn the stop numbers for two destinations, determined by the GM. You can learn additional numbers during your adventures. You can commit a new number to memory by studying it for 1 minute.

spell.name: Crustacean Form
entries: You create an ethereal crustacean form around your body, which protects and aids you in combat. For the duration, you have a {@variantrule Swim Speed|XPHB} of 40 feet, {@sense Blindsight|XPHB} with a range of 30 feet, and an {@variantrule Armor Class|XPHB} of 20 if your AC is lower than that. In addition, you can take a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to make an {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB} using your claws. This attack deals {@damage 1d10} Bludgeoning damage instead of the normal damage for your {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB}, and you use your spellcasting ability modifier for the attack and damage rolls instead of Strength. Additionally, your ethereal shell has a {@variantrule Damage Threshold|XPHB} of 15 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}. This grants you {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB} to all damage unless you take an amount of damage from a single attack or effect equal to or greater than your {@variantrule Damage Threshold|XPHB}, in which case you take that entire instance of damage. Any damage that fails to meet or exceed the shell's {@variantrule Damage Threshold|XPHB} is superficial and doesn't reduce your {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}.

spell.name: Dara Blocks

components.m: a pinch of sand and a piece of pottery

entries: You create five 1-foot {@variantrule Cube [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Cubes} of magical force known as dara blocks. Each dara block appears in a different unoccupied space of your choice within range and becomes magically fixed in place. The blocks are {@condition Invisible|XPHB} to all creatures except you and any creatures you designate when you cast the spell. A creature that can see the dara blocks (including one benefiting from {@spell See Invisibility|XPHB} or {@sense Truesight|XPHB}) sees a luminous cube made of a transparent, dark green light.

A block fixed in the air can hold up to 5,000 pounds; More weight causes the block to fall. A creature can take a {@action Utilize|XPHB} action to make a Strength check against your spell save DC, moving the block up to 10 feet on a success.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: You can create two additional dara blocks for each spell slot level above 3.

spell.name: Divine Arrow
entries: A bow made of light materializes as you fire an angelic arrow from it. Make a ranged spell attack against a creature or object within range. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 4d10} Force damage and, until the spell ends, has {@variantrule Vulnerability|XPHB} to one of the following damage types of your choice: Acid, Cold, Fire, Lightning, Necrotic, Radiant, or Thunder. If a creature has {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB} to the chosen damage type, it instead has {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to that type for the duration. If a creature has {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to the chosen damage type, it loses that {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} for the duration.

spell.name: Duplicate
entries: You create an exact replica of an object you can see within range that weighs no more than 25 pounds. At first glance, the two objects are indistinguishable from each other, and the duplicate functions as if it were the original, except for any magical properties the original object may have. The duplicate disappears when the spell ends.

If a creature takes a {@action Study|XPHB} action to examine the duplicate, it can determine that the duplicate is a replica with a successful Intelligence ({@skill Investigation|XPHB}) check against your spell save DC.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: The spell's duration can be extended by using a higher-level spell slot: 8 hours (level 2-3) or 24 hours (level 4+).

spell.name: Ember Belly

m.text: a flask of oil, which the spell consumes

entries: You swallow the oil consumed in the spell's casting. Once before the spell ends, you can exhale the oil as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, igniting it as you expel it from your body. Each creature in a 5-foot-wide, 30-foot-long {@variantrule Line [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Line} must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking {@damage 2d10} Fire damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one. Once you exhale the oil, the spell ends.

spell.name: Festival King
entries: Choose a creature you can see within range. A gaudy crown and cape appear on the target, accompanied by a disembodied arrangement of unseen brass instruments. For the duration, the target becomes the Festival King and exudes an aura of importance in a 20-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation}. When you cast this spell, you can designate creatures to be unaffected by it. Any other creature that enters the aura for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there must make a Charisma saving throw. A creature that is immune to the {@condition Charmed|XPHB} condition automatically succeeds on this save.

On a failed save, the creature becomes enamored with the Festival King, chanting and dancing around them. Until the spell ends, affected creatures can't take an action or a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, as they give all of their attention and admiration to the Festival King. These effects end on a creature when the spell ends or if the creature starts its turn outside of the Festival King's aura.

spell.name: Forest Guard
entries: You create a Small animated shrub, which grows from the ground in an unoccupied space of your choice that you can see within range. The shrub has several human-like characteristics, including a wooden body and face, but it lacks hands and arms and can't move.

Any enemy that moves to a space within 10 feet of the shrub for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there is targeted by the shrub's leaf attack. When it does so, the shrub makes a ranged spell attack, using your spell attack modifier. On a hit, the creature takes {@damage 1d4} Slashing damage.

On your turn, you can take a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to cause the shrub to make a leaf attack against one creature or object within 10 feet of it. If multiple shrubs created by you are within 10 feet of the target, the attack deals {@damage 1d4} Slashing damage per shrub on a hit.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: You can create additional shrubs by casting this spell using a higher-level spell slot: two shrubs (level 3-4 slot), three shrubs (level 5-6), four shrubs (level 7-8), or five shrubs (level 9).

spell.name: Gift
entries: Choose a creature you can see within range. You take {@damage 1d20} Necrotic damage, and the target regains a number of {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to the damage you took.

spell.name: Jolt
entries: A jolt of electricity springs from you toward a creature or object you can see within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 1d8} Lightning damage.

Alternatively, you can target a machine within range and temporarily power it, allowing it to function as if it were whelmed by a spirit or permanently enchanted. Machines targeted by this spell stay powered for 18 seconds before shutting off. For a machine to function using this spell, it must still be in working condition.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cantrip Upgrade
entries: The damage increases by {@dice 1d8} when you reach levels 5 ({@dice 2d8}), 11 ({@dice 3d8}), and 17 ({@dice 4d8}).

spell.name: Light Snare
entries: A shimmering band of energy streaks toward a creature or object within range and envelops it in a spectacular burst of light. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target has the {@condition Restrained|XPHB} condition and is magically fixed in place until the end of its next turn.

spell.name: Mass Levitate
entries: Up to six creatures or loose objects of your choice that you can see within range rise vertically up to 20 feet and remain suspended there for the duration. Each object levitated by the spell can weigh up to 500 pounds. An unwilling creature that succeeds on a Constitution saving throw is unaffected.

A target can move only by pushing or pulling against a fixed object or surface within reach (such as a wall or a ceiling), which allows it to move as if it were climbing. You can change the altitude of any number of targets by up to 20 feet in either direction on your turn. If you are one of the targets, you can move up or down as part of your move. Otherwise, you can take a {@action Magic|XPHB} action to move the targets, which must remain within the spell's range.
When the spell ends, the targets float gently to the ground if they are still aloft.

spell.name: Monkey's Grasp
entries: You summon a large, ethereal monkey's paw that rises up and attempts to grapple a Huge or smaller creature on the ground that you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw, or it has the {@condition Grappled|XPHB} condition, with an escape DC equal to your spell save DC.
While {@condition grappled} by the paw, the target takes {@damage 1d8} Necrotic damage at the start of each of its turns. When the grapple is broken, the paw disappears and the spell ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: You can target one additional creature for each spell slot level above 2, summoning a separate monkey's paw for each target. When you do so, the spell doesn't end until thelast paw disappears.

spell.name: Mushroom Ballista
entries: You touch up to three pieces of ammunition and imbue them with unique toadstool magic. The targeted ammunition sprouts plump green mushrooms around it or its tip.

When a creature is hit with a ranged attack using the ammunition, it takes an extra {@damage 1d6} Poison damage and must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is pushed a number of feet away from the attacker equal to the damage taken (rounded up to the nearest 5 feet), to a maximum of 15 feet. Whether the attack hits or misses, the spell then ends on that piece of ammunition. If you cast this spell again, it ends on any ammunition still affected by your previous casting.

spell.name: Obscure Object
entries: An object you can see within range becomes {@condition Invisible|XPHB} until the spell ends. The object must be no larger than a 5-foot {@variantrule Cube [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Cube} and it can't be worn by an unwilling creature.

spell.name: Origami Bird Swarm

m.text: fine papers worth 10 gp, which the spell consumes

entries: A swarm of eight origami birds erupts from the stack of papers consumed in the casting of the spell and flies toward a creature you can see within range. If the target is within 30 feet of you when you cast the spell, the swarm collides with it, dealing {@damage 8d6} Slashing damage, and the birds disappear.

If the target is farther than 30 feet away from you when you cast the spell, the swarm immediately moves 30 feet toward the target, and it moves another 30 feet toward the target at the start of each of your turns. The swarm ignores {@variantrule Difficult Terrain|XPHB} and moves around creatures and other obstructions as needed. While the swarm exists, it occupies a 5-foot-{@variantrule Cube [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Cube} area as if it were a Medium creature.
While traveling toward the target, the swarm can be attacked. It has an AC equal to your spell save DC. For every attack that hits it, the number of birds in the swarm is reduced by one.

At the start of your turn when the swarm reaches its target, the target takes {@damage 1d6} Slashing damage for each bird remaining in the swarm. The birds then disappear. The birds disappear early if the target travels to a different plane of existence from them.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: The number of birds in the swarm increases by two for each spell slot level above 5. If the target is within 30 feet of you when you cast the spell, it takes an extra {@damage 2d6} Slashing damage for each spell slot level above 5.

spell.name: Pacify Monster
entries: You attempt to pacify a creature you can see within range. The target must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, it has the {@condition Pacified|ObojimaTallGrass24} condition until the spell ends. A {@condition Pacified|ObojimaTallGrass24} creature can't attack, cast a spell that affects an enemy, or deal damage to another creature. The target can repeat the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: You can target one additional creature for each spell slot level above 4.

spell.name: Pacify Person
entries: You attempt to pacify a Humanoid you can see within range. The target must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, it has the {@condition Pacified|ObojimaTallGrass24} condition until the spell ends. A {@condition Pacified|ObojimaTallGrass24} creature can't attack, cast a spell that affects an enemy, or deal damage to another creature. The target can repeat the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: You can target one additional Humanoid for each spell slot level above 1.

spell.name: Pillar of Force
entries: You swiftly stomp your foot, conjuring a pillar of wood or stone that thrusts out from underneath you and toward a creature or object you can see within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 2d12} Bludgeoning damage, and if the target is Huge or smaller, it is pushed up to 10 feet away from you. The ground in a straight {@variantrule Line [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Line} between you and the target also becomes {@variantrule Difficult Terrain|XPHB}, with each 5-foot-{@variantrule Cube [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Cube} portion requiring at least 1 minute to clear by hand.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: The damage increases by {@dice 1d12} for each spell slot level above 2.

spell.name: Plummet
entries: You conjure an enormous glowing force that wraps around a flying creature within range and attempts to pull it out of the air. The target must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, it is pulled to the ground and takes damage from the fall as normal ({@damage 1d6} Bludgeoning damage for every 10 feet it fell, to a maximum of {@dice 20d6}). On a successful save, the target is pulled halfway to the ground and takes no damage.

spell.name: Pogmo's Pot
entries: You summon a Tiny cast iron pot in an unoccupied space on the ground within range. All objects in a 20-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} originating from the pot that are not being worn or carried and weigh no more than 10 pounds are instantly sucked inside, whether they look like they should fit or not. The objects are stored in an extradimensional space inside the pot until the spell ends, at which point the pot vanishes and the objects it contained appear on the ground in its space.

For the duration, the pot remains sealed, and the objects inside can't be accessed until the spell ends. The pot is 1 foot wide and 1 foot tall. It can be easily moved or carried and always weighs 15 pounds, regardless of the weight of the objects it contains. The pot has {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB} to all damage, but it can be dispelled.

spell.name: Rageful Nimbus
entries: Choose a creature within range. A pristine, fluffy white cloud appears above the target and follows it for the duration. If the target takes damage from an enemy you can see, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to make a ranged spell attack from the cloud, provided that enemy is within 60 feet of the target. On a hit, the enemy takes {@damage 2d8} Lightning damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: The damage increases based on the level of the spell slot used: {@dice 3d8} (level 4-5 slot), {@dice 4d8} (level 6-7 slot), or {@dice 5d8} (level 8-9 slot).

spell.name: Resilient Friendship
entries: You magically assist a creature within range, granting it the benefits of the {@action Help|XPHB} action. If the target successfully accomplishes the task by the start of your next turn, you gain {@dice 1d4} {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB}, which last for 1 hour.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cantrip Upgrade
entries: The number of {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} you gain increases when you reach levels 5 ({@dice 1d6}), 11 ({@dice 1d8}), and 17 ({@dice 1d10}).

spell.name: Retrieve
entries: You cause an object within range that isn't being worn or carried to fly to you. You can either catch it in your open hand or cause it to fall to the ground at your feet. If the object weighs more than 10 pounds, the spell fails.

spell.name: Root Grab

time.note: which you take when a creature provokes an {@action Opportunity Attack|XPHB} from you

entries: You cause roots to reach out and grasp at the creature that provoked the {@action Opportunity Attack|XPHB|Opportunity Attacks}, hindering its movement.
The target's {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} is reduced by 10 feet until the start of your next turn.

spell.name: Sand Structure
entries: A wall of sand that is 5 feet tall, 5 feet wide, and 1 foot thick materializes from the ground in an unoccupied space you can see within range. The sand functions as solid stone while in its wall form. The wall has AC 13 and 10 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}. Reducing the wall to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} destroys it and might cause connected walls to collapse at the GM's discretion. You can end the spell early by taking a {@action Magic|XPHB} action to dismiss it. When the spell ends, the wall crumbles back into sand.
If you cast the spell as a {@variantrule Ritual|XPHB}, the wall lasts until it is destroyed or dismissed.

spell.name: Shared Vision
entries: Choose a willing creature you're familiar with; the spell fails if the target isn't within range. For the duration, or until the target dismisses the spell as a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, it can see through your eyes, gaining the benefits of any special senses you have. Until the spell ends, the target can swap between its own vision and yours as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: You can target one additional willing creature for each spell slot level above 2.

spell.name: Spell Signature
entries: As you cast the spell, you draw out the potent scents trapped within all magic. Choose a magical effect you are aware of that's within range. That effect releases a scent specific to the creature that created it. If you are familiar with the creature, you automatically know that the magical effect was created by them.

If you are not familiar with the creature, you can make an ability check using your spellcasting ability and add your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus} to the roll. Refer to the table below to determine what information you glean from the scent, based on the result of your check.

rows: You learn what kind of creature created the magical effect.
You also learn the creature's class, if any.
You also learn the name of any organization the creature is affiliated with.
You also learn the name of the creature.

spell.name: Sprout Foliage
entries: You sprout and rapidly grow lush, leafy foliage that covers your entire body. When casting this spell, you can choose whether the foliage has other features, such as flowers or berries.

While you have the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition and remain motionless, you are indistinguishable from a normal bush. If a creature hasn't observed you move or act, it must succeed on an Intelligence ({@skill Investigation|XPHB}) check against your spell save DC to discern that you aren't a bush. To become disguised again to a creature that has already discerned you for what you are, you must take the {@action Hide|XPHB} action while unseen by that creature.

Until the spell ends, you can take a {@action Magic|XPHB} action to create and hurl a pinecone, berry, or flower bud at a creature or object within 30 feet of you. Make a ranged spell attack. On a hit, the target takes Bludgeoning damage equal to {@dice 1d6} + your spellcasting ability modifier.

spell.name: Storm Stallion
entries: Choose a 5-foot-{@variantrule Cube [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Cube} space that you can see within range. A Medium elemental stallion appears in that space, formed from a twisting gust of wind, and charges in a straight {@variantrule Line [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Line} up to 60 feet long in a direction of your choice. If the stallion appears in a space occupied by a creature that is Medium or smaller, that creature must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or be carried along with the stallion as it moves.

Each creature in the stallion's path (excluding the creature it's carrying, if any) must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking {@damage 6d8} Bludgeoning damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one. The stallion then vanishes.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: The damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each spell slot level above 4.

spell.name: Submerge
entries: This spell creates a magical link between a body of water within range and another body of water of your choice within 500 miles. You must have seen the destination body of water at least once before. For the duration, any creature can step into the target body of water and exit from the destination body of water by using 5 feet of movement. Both bodies of water must be large enough for the creature to become fully submerged. If either body of water isn't large enough for the creature to be fully submerged, there's a {@chance 25} chance that the creature instead exits from a random body of water on the same plane of existence.

spell.name: Summon Jack-o'-lantern
entries: A giant Jack-o'-lantern rapidly grows around up to four Medium or smaller creatures, or one Large creature, within a 5-foot- radius {@variantrule Sphere [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Sphere} centered on a point you can see within range. An unwilling creature in the area can make a Dexterity saving throw, moving 5 feet outside the Jack-o'-lantern on a success.

While inside the Jack-o'-lantern, creatures can see only through its eyes and mouth, which are located on one side of the Jack-o'-lantern, chosen by you when you cast this spell. The creatures can make attacks with Ranged or {@itemProperty R|XPHB|Reach} weapons only from this side. Creatures outside the Jack-o'-lantern see only a warm, glowing light when looking into its mouth or eyes. While the Jack-o'-lantern remains, no creature inside or outside of it can pass or reach through it.

The Jack-o'-lantern has AC 15 and 100 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, and it weighs 5,000 pounds. The lantern naturally loses 1 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} every 30 days. When the lantern is reduced to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, it is destroyed.

spell.name: Summon Vehicle
entries: You summon a bicycle or other moving machine in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of you. The vehicle can be no larger than a 5-foot {@variantrule Cube [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Cube} and can carry only one creature that is Medium or smaller. It has a {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} of 60 feet, which you can use while riding it, provided you have at least one free hand to operate the vehicle. When the spell ends, the vehicle vanishes.

spell.name: Swallow Magic

time.condition: which you take when you succeed on a saving throw against a spell cast by another creature, or an attack from such a spell misses you

entries: You chomp down on the threads of magic left behind after the triggering spell fails to affect you, swallowing the now-latent energy and gaining one of the following effects of your choice:

items: You regain {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to {@dice 1d4} + your spellcasting ability modifier.
Your {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} increases by 15 feet and you don't provoke {@action Opportunity Attack|XPHB|Opportunity Attacks} until the end of your next turn.
Once before the end of your next turn, you can roll a {@dice d6} and add the number rolled to a {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB} you make.

spell.name: Switched Form
entries: You give an illusory appearance to two Humanoids you can see within range, making each target look like the other—including its armor, clothing, weapons, and other belongings on its person. Each creature can seem 1 foot shorter or taller; the disguise otherwise replicates the other target's physical features as accurately as possible.
The changes wrought by this spell fail to hold up to physical inspection. For example, if this spell causes a creature to appear with a cape as part of its disguise, objects pass through the cape.

A creature that takes the {@action Study|XPHB} action to examine a target can make an Intelligence ({@skill Investigation|XPHB}) check against your spell save DC. If it succeeds, it becomes aware that the target is disguised.

spell.name: Tamh Gon's Fiery Festival Feast

m.text: an uncommon ingredient, which the spell consumes

entries: You sanctify a meal in an extravagant show of thrown spices and twirling dance. Those who participate in the meal are granted the curry blessings of the great festival spirit Tamh Gon. The feast takes 1 hour to consume, and the beneficial effects don't set in until this hour is over. Up to twelve creatures can partake of the feast.

A creature that partakes gains several benefits, which last for 24 hours. The creature's {@condition Exhaustion|XPHB} level, if any, decreases by 1, its {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} increases by 10 feet, and it gains a +2 bonus to Dexterity saving throws. It can also activate the effects of the {@spell Ember Belly|ObojimaTallGrass24} spell one time while the benefits of the feast last.

spell.name: Task
entries: With a flick of your wrist, you magically complete a small, simple task without any physical interaction—such as flipping a book page, sewing a tear in a shirt, or heating a cup of tea. The task can't include anything intended to inflict a harmful effect on a creature and must be something you could normally accomplish without the use of magic. The spell fails if the target of the task is behind {@variantrule Cover|XPHB|Total Cover}.
If you cast this spell multiple times, you can have up to three tasks active at a time.

spell.name: Transparency

time.condition: which you take when your location would be revealed to a creature while you are hidden or unseen)

entries: You temporarily turn {@condition Invisible|XPHB}, preventing you from being discovered by the triggering creature. Until the end of your next turn, you have the {@condition Invisible|XPHB} condition and your steps make no sound, regardless of the surface you are moving across. Anything you are wearing or carrying is also {@condition Invisible|XPHB} as long as it remains on your person. The spell ends early immediately after you make an attack roll, deal damage, or cast a spell.

spell.name: Vegetable Blade
entries: A lush bunch of vegetable fronds suddenly springs from the ground in an unoccupied space you can see within range. As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, a creature can pull the fronds from the ground, revealing a root vegetable of your choice grown in the shape of a blade. For the duration, a creature can use the vegetable blade as a Melee weapon with which it is proficient. The blade deals {@damage 1d12} Slashing damage on a hit (the wielder adds its ability modifier to the damage roll as normal), and it has {@itemProperty F|XPHB|Finesse}.

On subsequent turns, the wielder or one of its allies within reach can take a bite out of the blade as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}. Doing so heals the creature for a number of {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to the blade's damage die + your spellcasting ability modifier. Once a creature has taken a bite out of the blade, its damage die is reduced by one size—from a {@dice d12} to a {@dice d10}, for example. If a bite is taken when its damage die is a {@dice d4}, the blade is destroyed and the spell ends early.

spell.name: Water Bullet
entries: You create a sphere of swirling water that spins rapidly in your hand or mouth before you hurl it at a creature or object within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes Bludgeoning damage based on how far it is from you:

items: 1-10 feet: {@damage 5d6}
11-60 feet: {@damage 4d6}
61-90 feet: {@damage 3d6}

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: The damage increases by {@damage 1d6} for each spell slot level above 1.

spell.name: Whelm Weapon
entries: Up to three weapons of your choice that you can see within range become enveloped in water. Roll a {@dice d4}; for the duration, any damage dealt by the weapons is reduced by the number rolled (to a minimum of 1 damage).

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: You can target two additional weapons for each spell slot level above 1.

spell.name: Wind Sprint
entries: A tempest wind churns around you until the end of the turn. You are immediately lifted by the winds, which carry you toward another creature you can see within range. If the winds move you within reach of the target, and you immediately make a melee attack against it using a weapon or an {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB}, the target takes an extra {@damage 2d6} Slashing damage as the winds batter it.

baseitem.name: Amber
entries: This chunk of petrified tree sap is prized for its color and gem-like luster and is often used in jewelry. Some arcane jewelers claim that it has special properties, especially if an ancient insect is trapped within it. Amber can be found in rocky areas where petrified wood is found, and it has been known to wash up on certain beaches.
lootTables: Land of Hot Water Ingredients; Common|ObojimaTallGrass24|Land of Hot Water

baseitem.name: Apper Carrot
entries: The Apper Carrot is well known throughout Obojima as a superior strain of carrot that has a delicious flavor and a hearty crunch. Its bulbous top peeks out from the soil when it's ready for harvesting, making it easy for foragers to spot Apper Carrots in the wild. They can be found in most grassy lowland areas.
lootTables: Gift of Shuritashi Ingredients; Common|ObojimaTallGrass24|Gift of Shuritashi

baseitem.name: Bamboo
entries: Used in everything from building material to drinking vessels and musical instruments, bamboo is perhaps the most versatile material on the island. Patches of bamboo can be found in most places on Obojima, however there are a few bamboo forests in the foothills and mountainous regions where it can grow as thick as a tree.
lootTables: Gift of Shuritashi Ingredients; Common|ObojimaTallGrass24|Gift of Shuritashi
Land of Hot Water Ingredients; Common|ObojimaTallGrass24|Land of Hot Water

baseitem.name: Bashu Powder
entries: This russet powder is made from the ground seed pods of the bashu tree. Bashu powder is used commonly by chefs who want to add a spicy yet smoky flavor to their dishes. Most Obojimans believe that bashu powder also helps alleviate minor ailments like coughs and colds. Bashu trees are found inland in the warm and arid regions of Obojima.
lootTables: Gift of Shuritashi Ingredients; Common|ObojimaTallGrass24|Gift of Shuritashi
Land of Hot Water Ingredients; Common|ObojimaTallGrass24|Land of Hot Water

baseitem.name: Bellow Flute
entries: The traditional Obojiman instrument has gotten a second life as a swift, clublike weapon commonly used by traveling performers. It is crafted from a special coral found all across the Shallows, which naturally forms with dozens of tiny holes that run throughout the body of the instrumental weapon. When swung, it emits a beautiful harmonic sound.

baseitem.name: Black Cinnamon
entries: For some reason that is unknown, black cinnamon trees emanate a subtle magic and one in every hundred or so cinnamon trees across Obojima gains this special trait. There are many legends surrounding the first black cinnamon tree. Kuroki village tells the tale of a wizard who walked into a cinnamon tree, turning it black—the sacred tree still stands to this day in the center of Kuroki Temple.

baseitem.name: Black Pearl
entries: Nothing is more coveted by purveyors of magic than the dreamlike luster of a black pearl. Some magicians claim that gazing into the swirling iridescence of a black pearl can bring you visions of a possible future event or help you find a missing object. Black pearls are found inside the giant hornshell clams that are found in the Shallows around Obojima, and most of these are guarded fiercely by fish folk warriors.

baseitem.name: Blossom of Spirit Vine
entries: There are three cryptic alchemical tomes on Obojima that speak of the arcane energies of spirit vine and its uses. Only the most expert potion makers understand how to work with this plant, and of those, only a few can fully release its power. Spirit vine only grows in the Spirit Realm, where it is abundant. However, what makes this plant unique is the blossom. At any given moment, there is only one blossom in existence. When it wilts or is harvested, another one will form on another vine in a random location.

baseitem.name: Blue Back Salmon
entries: The fat-marbled, delicious flesh of the blue back salmon are a staple in many villages across the island. A fully grown salmon can reach up to almost two meters in length and any fisherman will tell you that they are crafty, hard to catch, and can deliver a nasty bite. Blue back salmon are found in rivers all across Obojima and in the deepest parts of the surrounding reef.
lootTables: Gift of Shuritashi Ingredients; Common|ObojimaTallGrass24|Gift of Shuritashi
Land of Hot Water Ingredients; Common|ObojimaTallGrass24|Land of Hot Water

baseitem.name: Boom Beri
entries: These small red berries are a delicious sweet treat for roughly three weeks of the year. Outside of that time they're quite disgusting and left untouched by forest dwellers. They're often found near the base of mountains or cliff faces.
lootTables: Gift of Shuritashi Ingredients; Common|ObojimaTallGrass24|Gift of Shuritashi
Land of Hot Water Ingredients; Common|ObojimaTallGrass24|Land of Hot Water

entries.name: Special
entries: After being thrown, a Boomerang returns to your space. You can either allow it to fall to the ground in your space or take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to catch it in your open hand.

baseitem.name: Bora Bug
entries: These hazelnut-sized beetles can be found sipping the sugary sap from trees or drinking the juice from overripe fruit that has fallen to the forest floor. Obojimans crush up dried bora bugs to produce a beautiful turquoise dye. Bora bugs are usually found on or around any tree that produces fruit or a sweet sap.
lootTables: Gift of Shuritashi Ingredients; Common|ObojimaTallGrass24|Gift of Shuritashi

baseitem.name: Bottle Cap (Supa-Fizz!)
entries: Perhaps the metal of the bottle cap is why they contain latent magic so sought after by potion makers... or perhaps is simply the power of Supa-Fizz! With a bit of knowledge and some diligent digging, these bottle caps can be found in and around the more habitable areas of Obojima.
lootTables: Gift of Shuritashi Ingredients; Uncommon|ObojimaTallGrass24|Gift of Shuritashi
Land of Hot Water Ingredients; Uncommon|ObojimaTallGrass24|Land of Hot Water

baseitem.name: Bottled Lightning
entries: Few wizards attempt such a feat and even fewer succeed at bottling lightning. The method, magic, and equipment used in achieving bottled lightning are all closely guarded secrets. For those wishing to get some of this crackling power, be warned that wizards charge a hefty fee for even the smallest bottle. Wizards who bottle lightning can be found, usually by hearing stories of their mountaintop towers or their mad wandering into lightning storms.

baseitem.name: Brush Reed
entries: Aside from making a nifty hairbrush, brush reed is also well-known for its potion making properties. Brush reeds can be found next to ponds and lakes in the lowland areas.
lootTables: Land of Hot Water Ingredients; Common|ObojimaTallGrass24|Land of Hot Water

baseitem.name: Bubble Gum
entries: Though its flavors are many, all bubble gum is rare. It is most commonly found stuck to walls or floors in ruined buildings or stuck to the bottoms of shoes. Rarer still is bubble gum found un-chewed and still in its foil wrapper. The chew-it-but-don't-swallow-it nature of bubble gum is confounding to many on the island, and academics on the island refer to the delightful substance as 'masticant.'

baseitem.name: Bundle of Driko Twigs
entries: The aromatic wood of the driko tree is a common scent in temples, shrines, and village markets on Obojima. Many woodcutters dry stacks of driko twigs in the sun making the summer months smell fantastic. Aside from being able to get driko twigs in almost any village, there are an abundance of driko trees all over the island.
lootTables: Gift of Shuritashi Ingredients; Common|ObojimaTallGrass24|Gift of Shuritashi
Land of Hot Water Ingredients; Common|ObojimaTallGrass24|Land of Hot Water

baseitem.name: Butterfly Staff
entries: Although it can be used as a weapon, the Butterfly Staff is more commonly used as a tool to catch small spirits and critters. Its tall haft is capped with a well-woven net, which is often made from sheep dragon wool.

entries.name: Special
entries: When you hit a Small or smaller creature with a melee attack roll using the Butterfly Staff, you can cause the target to have the {@condition Grappled|XPHB} condition instead of dealing damage. Until the grapple ends, the Butterfly Staff can't be used to make another attack.

baseitem.name: Camp Mite
entries: These small, spherical bugs are covered in stiff hairs that enable them to stick to fabric and even skin. They are drawn to the warmth of campfires and bedrolls; a fact attested to by anyone who's spent more than a couple of nights sleeping under the stars.
lootTables: Gift of Shuritashi Ingredients; Common|ObojimaTallGrass24|Gift of Shuritashi

baseitem.name: Candlemaker's Club
entries: These heavy honey dipper-shaped clubs are traditionally used for mixing the giant vats of wax used by the Courier Brigade to seal packages and craft candles. They're now used by postal knights and adventurers as a useful defensive and offensive tool.

entries.name: Special
entries: While wielding a Candle Maker's Club, you can take a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to extinguish an open flame within 5 feet of you.

baseitem.name: Chicken Egg
