{@font {@style 60|large}|SneakerProMedium}

item.name: Arcane Detection Kit
entries: Arcane Detection Kits (or ADKs) have been popularized by Witches in the last two decades as the desire for potions from local islanders has gradually increased. Although the contents of these kits vary depending on the coven and individual using them, there are a few staples found in nearly every kit, such as spark powder and arcana oil. No matter the contents, a skilled potion brewer can use the kit to sniff out the latent magic found in objects all across the island.

item.name: Bicycle
entries: These First Age vehicles have become increasingly popular over the years as recreations started being crafted out of Yatamon. Both the recreations and the originals have a {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} of 60 feet while being ridden.

item.name: Glider
entries: A creature holding onto a glider with both hands while falling, descends at a rate of 10 feet per round and can travel up to 50 feet horizontally. A creature can use its action to operate the glider, changing the direction they're moving and avoiding any obstacles in their path. If a creature is still in the air after 1 minute has passed, it must succeed on a DC 10 Strength saving throw or let go of the glider, falling as it normally would. This saving throw is repeated every minute, with the DC increasing by 2 every time the saving throw is made (to a maximum of DC 20).

item.name: Hook Sling
entries: This heavy metal contraption can be used to hurl a barbed hook at the surface of a solid object within 20 feet of you, latching onto it and pulling you toward the target. The hook can be hurled using a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, and it requires an action to wind it back in before you can use it again. You can hurl the hook using only one hand, but it requires two hands to wind the hook back in. If the targeted surface has no lip to grasp or is otherwise too difficult for the barb to hook onto, the hook fails to latch onto it and pull you.

item.name: Sea Sink Boots
entries: These weighted boots are used by the Mariners' Guild to quickly descend into the Shallows and explore the shallow beds. While wearing the boots, all nonmagical {@variantrule Speed|XPHB|Speeds} you possess are reduced to 10 feet, you descend into water at a rate of 100 feet per round, and you can walk across the ocean floor as if you weren't buoyant.

item.name: Bark Armor
entries: While wearing Bark Armor, you gain {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on Stealth checks made in wooded areas.

item.name: Scumweed Armor
entries: Scumweed is slimy and thick. Dried scumweed can even make hardy armor in a pinch and more than a few monsters and witches have been known to use it for precisely that purpose.

item.name: Divers Armor
entries: While wearing Divers Armor your movement is reduced by 10, unless your Strength score is equal to or greater than 18. Additionally, whenever the spell {@spell Water Breathing|XPHB} is cast on you while wearing the Divers Armor, the duration of the spell is doubled for you.

item.name: Pot Lid
entries: When taking the {@action Attack|XPHB} action with a {@itemProperty F|XPHB|Finesse} or {@itemProperty L|XPHB|Light} Melee weapon that you're holding in one hand, you can use a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to take the {@action Attack|XPHB} action with a Pot Lid that you're holding in the other hand. On a hit, the Pot Lid deals {@damage 1d4} Bludgeoning damage. You don't add your ability modifier to the damage of the Bonus Attack, unless that modifier is negative.

variantrule.name: Potion Sickness & Mishaps

entries: {@b This is an optional rule for GMs to add into their game as they see fit.}

Desperate, reckless, or curious characters will inevitably try to use more than one potion at the same time, or in rapid succession. In most cases, potions don't have stacking effects. The most recent potion imbibed negates any previous ones.

There are exceptions, however. Some potions are {@b Permanent}, which means their effects persist even when other potions are used, and they don't count toward the number of potions you have consumed for the purpose of Potion Sickness. To see if a potion has this property, check its description for the {@b Permanent} keyword.

Using multiple potions also comes with the risk of succumbing to Potion Sickness, a very unpleasant affliction that comes on at a moment's notice. Characters who decide to consume more than one potion in a day must first pass a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or fall violently ill. In place of the special effects the potion would normally grant the character instead vomits as the strange concoction of magical elixirs swirls inside their stomach. The DC for this save increases by 2 for each potion successfully used in a single day. {@b Thrown} or {@b Poured} potions do not count when calculating for Potion Sickness.

If a character is persistent and continues to use multiple potions in a day, they might stumble into a potion mishap. These random magical effects occur when a character fails a Potion Sickness check after already successfully using 3 potions that day. In addition to Potion Sickness, this character would also roll on the Potion Mishaps table below.
{@b Poured} and {@b Thrown} potions do not count towards the number of potions a creature can consume in a day.

rows: Sand fills your mouth, making it impossible to speak. This effect lasts for 1 minute.
You lose the ability to use your arms as they turn jelly-like in nature. This effect lasts until the end of your next turn.
Your vision blurs then pops back into clarity, only now all creatures look exactly the same to you and are indistinguishable except by touch. This effect lasts for 1 minute.
In a blur of magic, you shift into one of the following adorable critters, as if the spell {@spell Polymorph} was cast on you. (refer to the table below):

In a blinding flash of light and a sonic boom, you are teleported away. Roll {@dice 1d4} to determine direction with "1" being cardinal north and moving clockwise. Then roll {@dice 1d4} to determine how many hundreds of feet that you are teleported.
You can no longer control your voice, causing it to randomly change in volume as you speak. This effect lasts for 1 hour.
Eels grow in your gut for the next hour. Every so often you cough one up.
For the next week, the sight of potions makes you sick. You must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw to drink a potion.
Being within 5 feet of any kind of magic causes you to instantly break out in itchy hives, reducing any Charisma checks by 2. This allergy lasts for {@dice 1d4} days.
You gain the effect of a random {@filter common whimsy potion|items|source=obojimatallgrass24|type=potion|rarity=common|property=whimsical}.

language.name: Naku Naku
entries: Most Nakudama continue to speak their original language as well as the common tongue, and they claim theirs is far richer for the telling of tales.

language.name: Archaic First Age Languages
entries: The objects and structures from the island's earliest age contain a variety of written languages known to the islanders as First Age languages. Other than the academics who devote themselves to studying these mysterious languages, people generally know only a handful of words.

language.name: Torum
entries: Torum is the favored language of the Spirit Realm. Though non-spirits can learn to understand it, beings of the Physical Realm often can't make the layered sounds required to voice the words.
This weapon is crafted with strands of moonlight. At night, attacks with it deal an extra {@damage 1d8} Radiant damage on a hit.

This magical bow can split arrows as you fire it, allowing you to target two creatures within 10 feet of each other. When you use the bow in this way, you make only one attack roll, which applies to both targets. If the attack hits at least one of the targets, roll damage normally. A target hit by a split arrow takes half the amount of damage rolled (round down).

A creature in possession of both the {@item Lunar Weapon|ObojimaTallGrass24} and the {@item Solar Amulet|ObojimaTallGrass24} can perform a 1-hour ritual to combine those items, forming the Weapon of the Sun and Moon. This weapon retains the properties of the {@item Lunar Weapon|ObojimaTallGrass24} and grants you the benefits of the {@item Solar Amulet|ObojimaTallGrass24} while holding it.

In addition, you gain a +1 bonus to attack rolls and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action while holding the Weapon of the Sun and Moon, you can activate its Eclipse Power. Doing so during the day casts the {@spell Darkness|XPHB} spell; this version of the spell causes the darkness to fill a 60-foot-radius {@variantrule Sphere [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Sphere} or a 60-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation}, instead of its normal size. Doing so during the night, casts the {@spell Daylight|XPHB} spell. Once the daytime Eclipse Power is used, it can't be used again until the next dawn; once the nighttime Eclipse Power is used, it can't be used again until the next dusk.

trait.name: Like the Wind
entries: The Wild Spirit can move through other creatures' spaces as if they were {@variantrule Difficult Terrain|XPHB}.

trait.name: Promising Threat
entries: The Wild Spirit has {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on Charisma ({@skill Intimidation|XPHB}) checks if the target has seen it hit a creature with its Chomp attack in the past minute.

action.name: Chomp
entries: {@atkr m} {@hitYourSpellAttack Bonus equals your spell attack modifier}, reach 5 ft. {@h}{@damage 2d6 + 2} Piercing damage, and the target has the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition if it is Large or smaller.

reaction.name: Devour
entries: {@actTrigger} The Wild Spirit reduces a creature to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}. {@actResponse} The Wild Spirit regains {@dice 1d10} {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}.

trait.name: Great Heights
entries: When the Acorn Crab falls at least 10 feet during its turn and makes a Slam attack at the end of the fall, it takes no damage from the fall.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Acorn Crab makes two Pinch attacks.

action.name: Pinch
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 5}, reach 5 ft. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) Piercing damage.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 5}, reach 5 ft. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) Bludgeoning damage. The target takes an extra 3 ({@damage 1d6}) Bludgeoning damage for every 10 feet the acorn crab fell before the attack.

spellcasting.name: Levitate
headerEntries: The akaobata casts the {@spell Mass Levitate|ObojimaTallGrass24} spell, requiring no Material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 15}).

trait.name: Heightened Magic Resistance
entries: The akaobata automatically succeeds on saving throws against spells of level 5 or lower, and the attack rolls of such spells automatically miss it; it has {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on saving throws against all other spells and magical effects. Without the akaobata's permission, no spell of level 5 or lower can observe the akaobata remotely or detect its thoughts, creature type, or alignment.

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries: The akaobata can move through other creatures and objects as if they were {@variantrule Difficult Terrain|XPHB}. It takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) Force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

action.name: Cursed Touch
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 7}, reach 5 ft. {@h}20 ({@damage 3d10 + 4}) Psychic damage. The target's emotions are overwhelmed with fear, hate, sorrow, confusion, or regret, and the akaobata becomes emboldened (see below) until the end of the turn.

bonus.name: The following Bonus Actions can only be taken while the akaobata is emboldened
Fleeting Strengths
entries: {@actSave wis} {@dc 15}, one creature the akaobata can see within 60 feet. {@actSaveFail} The target is cursed. Until the curse ends, the target loses proficiency in one saving throw or skill of the akaobata's choice.

bonus.name: Power of Whispers
entries: {@actSave con} {@dc 15}, one creature the akaobata can see within 60 feet. {@actSaveFail} 11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) Psychic damage, and the target has the {@condition Restrained|XPHB} condition until the end of its next turn.

trait.name: Aquatic Memory
entries: {@variantrule Difficult Terrain|XPHB} composed of ice or snow doesn't cost the bearracuda extra movement.

trait.name: Pacifying Light
entries: When the bearracuda gains the {@condition Blinded|XPHB} condition due to a light-based effect, it must also succeed on a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw or have the {@condition Unconscious|XPHB} condition for 1 minute, until it takes damage, or until a creature takes an action to shake it awake.

action.name: Chomp
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 6}, reach 5 ft. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) Piercing damage.

reaction.name: Drag
entries: {@actTrigger} The bearracuda grapples a creature that is its size or smaller. {@actResponse} The bearracuda moves up to its {@variantrule Fly Speed|XPHB}, carrying the {@condition Grappled|XPHB} creature with it.

trait.name: Light on Its Feet
entries: When the cat falls falls and doesn't have the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition, it can subtract up to 200 feet when calculating damage from the fall.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The cat makes one Chomp attack and one Claw attack.

action.name: Chomp
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 9}, reach 10 ft. {@h}25 ({@damage 3d12 + 6}) Piercing damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it has the {@condition Grappled|XPHB} condition (escape {@dc 16}). Until the grapple ends, the target has the {@condition Restrained|XPHB} condition, and the cat can't can't Chomp another target.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 9}, reach 10 ft. {@h}22 ({@damage 3d10 + 6}) Slashing damage.

action.name: Leaping Strike
entries: The cat jumps jumps up to 100 feet vertically; it can make one Claw attack while in the air. {@actSave str} {@dc 17}, each creature other than the cat within within 20 feet of where it lands. {@actSaveFail} The target has the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition.

trait.name: Endless Resource
entries: If the corrupted muk is standing in a pool of Corruption or is connected to the greater Corruption in some way, it regains 10 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} at the start of its turn.

trait.name: Persistent Disease
entries: There is a 15 percent chance that 7 days after a corrupted muk is killed, a new corrupted muk materializes in the location where the previous one died. If it dies in a pool of Corruption, there is a 100 percent chance instead.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 3}, reach 5 ft. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d6 + 1}) Bludgeoning damage.

trait.name: Hypnotic
entries: {@actSave wis} {@dc 12}, any enemy that starts its turn in a 30-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} originating from the crawler (creatures immune to the {@condition Charmed|XPHB} condition automatically succeed on this save). {@actSaveFail} The target must use all of its movement this turn to get as close to the crawler as possible, moving by the safest route.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The crawler makes three attacks, using Constrict or Stomp in any combination.

action.name: Constrict
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 6}, reach 5 ft. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) Bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it is subjected to the following effect. {@actSave int} {@dc 12}. {@actSaveFail} The target loses its memory of the last 24 hours; it regains these memories if it's targeted by the {@spell Greater Restoration|XPHB} spell.

action.name: Stomp
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 6}, reach 10 ft. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d10 + 3}) Bludgeoning damage.

trait.name: Illusionary Lure
entries: An image of a creature, object, or effect of the deep angler's choice surrounds its lure, causing the chosen image to look as if it were floating in space. The image can't create sounds or smells, and physical interaction with the image reveals it to be an illusion, since things can pass through it.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The deep angler makes one Chomp attack and one Lure attack.

action.name: Chomp
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 10}, reach 10 ft. {@h}2 ({@damage 3d10 + 6}) Piercing damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it has the {@condition Grappled|XPHB} condition (escape {@dc 16}), and has the {@condition Restrained|XPHB} condition until the grapple ends.

action.name: Lure
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 10}, reach 20 ft. {@h}19 ({@damage 3d8 + 6}) Bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it is subjected to the following effect. {@actSave con} {@dc 16}. {@actSaveFail} The target has the {@condition Blinded|XPHB} condition until the end of its next turn.

bonus.name: Swallow
entries: {@actSave str} {@dc 18}, one Large or smaller creature {@condition Grappled|XPHB} by the deep angler (it can have up to three creatures swallowed at a time). {@actSaveFail} The target is swallowed by the deep angler, and the {@condition Grappled|XPHB} condition ends. A swallowed creature has the {@condition Blinded|XPHB} and {@condition Restrained|XPHB} conditions, has {@variantrule Cover|XPHB|Total Cover} against attacks and other effects outside the deep angler, and takes 14 ({@damage 4d6}) Acid damage at the start of each of the deep angler's turns. If the deep angler takes 15 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, the deep angler must succeed on a {@dc 19} Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, each of which enters an empty space within 5 feet of the deep angler and has the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition. If the deep angler dies, any swallowed creature no longer has the {@condition Restrained|XPHB} condition and can escape from the corpse using 20 feet of movement, exiting {@condition Prone|XPHB}.

trait.name: Intrusive Thoughts
entries: {@actSave int} {@dc 11}, any creature in a 10-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} originating from the demon at the start of the demon's turn. {@actSaveFail} The target is cursed until the start of the demon's next turn. Until the curse ends, the target takes an extra 4 ({@damage 1d8}) Psychic damage whenever it is hit by the demon's Bite attack.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The demon has {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The demon makes one Chomp attack and one Spectral Pass attack.

action.name: Chomp
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 4}, reach 5 ft. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) Piercing damage.

action.name: Spectral Pass
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 4}, reach 5 ft. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d10 + 2}) Necrotic damage.

spellcasting.name: Draconic Charm
headerEntries: The dragon casts {@spell Dominate Person|XPHB} (level 8 version), requiring no spell components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 12}).

trait.name: Resting Protections
entries: While the dragon has the {@condition Unconscious|XPHB} condition, it automatically succeeds on saving throws against spells of level 3 or lower, and the attack rolls of such spells automatically miss it; it has {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on saving throws against all other magical effects. In addition, no spell of level 3 or lower can observe the dragon remotely or detect its thoughts, creature type, or alignment.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The dragon makes three Rend attacks.

action.name: Rend
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 5}, reach 5 ft. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) Slashing damage.

monster.name: Dragon Frog
languages: understands Common and Naku Naku but can't speak

trait.name: Magic Removal
entries: When a creature or object becomes {@condition Grappled|XPHB} by the dragon frog's Bite attack or otherwise enclosed within the dragon frog's mouth, any spell of level 3 or lower on the target ends.

trait.name: Standing Leap
entries: The dragon frog's {@variantrule Long Jump|XPHB} is up to 30 feet and its {@variantrule High Jump|XPHB} is up to 15 feet with or without a running start.

action.name: Chomp
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 4}, reach 5 ft. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d6 + 2}) Piercing damage. If the target is a Tiny creature, it has the {@condition Grappled|XPHB} condition (escape {@dc 12}), and it has the {@condition Restrained|XPHB} condition until the grapple ends.

bonus.name: Pulling Tongue
entries: {@actSave str} {@dc 12}, one Medium or smaller target within 15 feet; if the target is an object that is being worn or carried by a creature, the creature makes this save. {@actSaveFail} The target is pulled to an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the dragon frog.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the dragon frog fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Removal
entries: When a creature or object becomes {@condition Grappled|XPHB} by the dragon frog's Bite attack or otherwise enclosed within the dragon frog's mouth, any spell of level 6 or lower on the target ends.

trait.name: Standing Leap
entries: The dragon frog's {@variantrule Long Jump|XPHB} is up to 90 feet and its {@variantrule High Jump|XPHB} is up to 45 feet with or without a running start.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The dragon frog makes one Chomp attack and two Claw attacks. It can replace the Chomp attack with a use of Swallow.

action.name: Chomp
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 13}, reach 10 ft. {@h}16 ({@damage 2d8 + 7}) Piercing damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it has the {@condition Grappled|XPHB} condition (escape {@dc 18}), and it has the {@condition Restrained|XPHB} condition until the grapple ends.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 13}, reach 5 ft. {@h}12 ({@damage 1d10 + 7}) Slashing damage.

bonus.name: Pulling Tongue
entries: {@actSave str} {@dc 21}, one Huge or smaller target within 60 feet; if the target is an object that is being worn or carried by a creature, the creature makes this save. {@actSaveFail} The target is pulled to an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the dragon frog.

bonus.name: Swallow
entries: {@actSave str} {@dc 21}, one Large or smaller creature {@condition Grappled|XPHB} by the dragon frog (it can have up to three creatures swallowed at a time). {@actSaveFail} The target is swallowed by the dragon frog, and the {@condition Grappled|XPHB} condition ends. A swallowed creature has the {@condition Blinded|XPHB} and {@condition Restrained|XPHB} conditions, has {@variantrule Cover|XPHB|Total Cover} against attacks and other effects outside the dragon frog, and takes 21 ({@damage 6d6}) Acid damage at the start of each of the dragon frog's turns.

If the dragon frog takes 20 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, the dragon frog must succeed on a {@dc 23} Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, each of which enters an empty space within 10 feet of the dragon frog and has the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition. If the dragon frog dies, any swallowed creature no longer has the {@condition Restrained|XPHB} condition and can escape from the corpse using 20 feet of movement, exiting {@condition Prone|XPHB}.

legendary.name: Croak
entries: {@actSave con} {@dc 21}, each creature in a 90-foot {@variantrule Cone [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Cone} (including each creature in the dragon frog's mouth). {@actSaveFail} 33 ({@damage 6d10}) Thunder damage, and the target is pushed up to 15 feet straight away from the dragon frog. {@actSaveSuccess} Half damage only. {@actSaveSuccessOrFail} If the target was {@condition Grappled|XPHB} by the dragon frog, it lands in an unoccupied space within 15 feet of the dragon frog and has the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition. The dragon frog can't take this action again until the start of its next turn.

legendary.name: Leap
entries: The dragon frog leaps straight into the air before slamming back down to the ground. {@actSave str} {@dc 22}, each creature in a 30-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} originating from the dragon frog. {@actSaveFail} The target has the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition.

legendary.name: Rend
entries: The dragon frog makes one Claw attack. If it is grappling a creature, it can make a Chomp attack against it instead.

trait.name: Like the Wind
entries: The dustbunny doesn't provoke {@action Opportunity Attack|XPHB|Opportunity Attacks} when it moves out of an enemy's reach.

action.name: Kick
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 4}, reach 5 ft. {@h}1 Bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Dust Fling
entries: {@actSave con} {@dc 10}, one creature within 10 feet. {@actSaveFail} The target has the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition until the end of its next turn.

action.name: Teleport
entries: The dustbunny teleports up to 20 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

trait.name: Without Need
entries: The Field Giant doesnt require food, drink, or sleep.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The demon has {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 7}, reach 5 ft. {@h}16 ({@damage 2d10 + 5}) Bludgeoning damage. If the target is Huge or smaller, it is pushed up to 15 feet straight away from the field giant.

trait.name: Limited Amphibiousness
entries: The fish folk can breathe air and water, but it must be submerged at least once every 4 hours to avoid suffocating outside water.

trait.name: Lucky Fool (1/Day)
entries: When the fish folk would fail an ability check or miss with an attack roll by rolling a 5 or lower on the die, it can replace the die roll with a 12 instead.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The fish folk makes one Chomp attack and one Shortsword attack.

action.name: Chomp
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 4}, reach 5 ft. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) Piercing damage.

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 4}, reach 5 ft. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) Slashing damage.

trait.name: Limited Amphibiousness
entries: The Lionfish King can breathe air and water, but it must be submerged at least once every 12 hours to avoid suffocating outside water.

trait.name: Lucky Fool (2/Day)
entries: When the Lionfish King would fail an ability check or miss with an attack roll by rolling a 5 or lower on the die, he can replace the die roll with a 15 instead.

action.name: Drain Heat
entries: {@atkr m} makes one Chomp attack and two Scimitar attacks.

action.name: Chomp
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 7}, reach 5 ft. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d4 + 4}) Piercing damage.

action.name: Scimitar
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 7}, reach 5 ft. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) Slashing damage.

action.name: Poisonous Spray
entries: {@actSave con} {@dc 14}, one creature within 30 feet. {@actSaveFail} 19 ({@damage 3d12}) Poison damage, and the target has the {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} condition until the end of its next turn. {@actSaveSuccess} Half damage only.

bonus.name: Royal Decree
entries: The Lionfish King commands a fish folk that can hear him to use its {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to make an attack against a creature he can see.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The jellyfish can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Toxins
entries: {@actSave con} {@dc 12}, any creature that comes in physical contact with the jellyfish. {@actSaveFail} 3 ({@damage 1d6}) Poison damage, and the target has the {@condition Stunned|XPHB} condition until the end of its next turn.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The giant koi can breathe air and water.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The giant koi makes three Slam attacks.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 15}, reach 5 ft. {@h}33 ({@damage 4d12 + 7}) Bludgeoning damage.

trait.name: Cursed Form
entries: The goro goro can't regain {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, except through the use of its Delectable Flavor trait.

trait.name: Delectable Flavor
entries: The goro goro regains 3 ({@dice 1d6}) {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} whenever it hits a creature that is drunk or affected by its Drunken Aura with a Rend attack.

trait.name: Drunken Aura
entries: {@actSave con} {@dc 15}, any creature that starts its turn in a 20-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} originating from the goro goro. {@actSaveFail} The target takes a -4 penalty to {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB|D20 Tests} until the start of its next turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The goro goro makes three Rend attacks. It can replace one attack with a use of Giant Sake Cup.

action.name: Rend
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 6}, reach 5 ft. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d10 + 3}) Slashing damage.

action.name: Giant Sake Cup
entries: {@actSave dex} {@dc 14}, one target within 10 feet. {@actSaveFail} 9 ({@damage 1d12 + 3}) Bludgeoning damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it is trapped under the goro goro's sake cup. A trapped target has the {@condition Blinded|XPHB} and {@condition Restrained|XPHB} conditions, has {@variantrule Cover|XPHB|Total Cover} against attacks and other effects outside the sake cup, and gains 1 {@condition Exhaustion|XPHB} level at the end of each of its turns.

To escape, the target or a creature within 5 feet of the sake cup must take an action to make a {@dc 15} Strength ({@skill Athletics|XPHB}) check, freeing the trapped creature on a success. The effect also ends early if the goro goro uses its Giant Sake Cup again or otherwise lifts the cup.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The hammer gull makes two Peck attacks. It can replace one attack with a use of Boulder Drop.

action.name: Peck
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 5}, reach 5 ft. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) Bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Boulder Drop
entries: {@actSave dex} {@dc 13}, one target directly below the hammer gull. {@actSaveFail} 10 ({@damage 3d6}) Bludgeoning damage, and the target has the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition.

trait.name: Flyby
entries: The harpy doesn't provoke an {@action Opportunity Attack|XPHB} when it flies out of an enemy's reach.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 4} (with {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} if the target doesn't have all its {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}), reach 5 ft. {@h}7 ({@damage 2d4 + 2}) Slashing damage.

reaction.name: Battle Fury (1/Day)
entries: {@actTrigger} The harpy sees an ally drop to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}. {@actResponse} The harpy makes an attack with its Claws or gains 10 {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} (harpy's choice).

trait.name: Hunting Prowess
entries: If the hill dragon didn't make an attack on its previous turn, its {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} increases by 15 feet at the start of its turn. This benefit can stack up to three times (a maximum increase of 45 feet). Once the hill dragon makes an attack, its {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} returns to normal.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The hill dragon makes two Rend attacks and one Tail attack.

action.name: Rend
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 5}, reach 5 ft. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) Slashing damage.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 5}, reach 10 ft. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d10 + 3}) Bludgeoning damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it has the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition.

bonus.name: Use of Terrain
entries: The hill dragon takes the {@action Hide|XPHB} action. It can only use this {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} if it is in a field or grassy environment.

trait.name: Sleep-Deprived
entries: The howler has {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on saving throws it makes to avoid or end the {@condition Charmed|XPHB} and {@condition Unconscious|XPHB} conditions.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The howler makes two attacks, using Chomp, Club, or Longbow in any combination.

action.name: Chomp
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 4}, reach 5 ft. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) Piercing damage.

action.name: Club
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 4}, reach 5 ft. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) Bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atkr r} {@hit 3}, range 150/600 ft. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d8 + 1}) Piercing damage.

reaction.name: Discouraging Chuckle
entries: {@actTrigger} A creature misses the howler with an attack. {@actResponse} The next time the attacker makes an ability check or an attack roll before the end of its next turn, it must subtract {@dice 1d4} from the total.

trait.name: Sleep-Deprived
entries: The howler has {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on saving throws it makes to avoid or end the {@condition Charmed|XPHB} and {@condition Unconscious|XPHB} conditions.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The howler makes three attacks, using Chomp, Club, or Longbow in any combination. It can replace one attack with a use of Pack Leader.

action.name: Chomp
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 4}, reach 5 ft. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) Piercing damage.

action.name: Club
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 4}, reach 5 ft. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) Bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atkr r} {@hit 4}, range 150/600 ft. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) Piercing damage.

action.name: Pack Leader
entries: The howler chooses one of the following effects; each of the howler's allies that can see it gains that benefit:

entries.name: Inspire
entries: The ally gains a +2 bonus to attack rolls until the end of its next turn.

entries.name: Regroup
entries: The ally can immediately move up to half its {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} without provoking {@action Opportunity Attack|XPHB|Opportunity Attacks}.

reaction.name: Discouraging Chuckle
entries: {@actTrigger} A creature misses the howler with an attack. {@actResponse} The next time the attacker makes an ability check or an attack roll before the end of its next turn, it must subtract {@dice 1d4} from the total.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The clone of Viota casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 13}, {@hit 5} to hit with spell attacks):

spellcasting.name: Misty Step
headerEntries: The clone of Viota casts the {@spell Misty Step|XPHB} spell, using the same spellcasting ability as Spellcasting.

trait.name: Lessons Learned
entries: At the start of combat, the clone of Viota can choose one of the following benefits against a creature if any clone of Viota has fought that creature before:

items.name: Guarded
entries: The clone of Viota has {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on saving throws against effects created by the creature.

items.name: Vengeful
entries: The clone of Viota has {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on attack rolls against the creature.

trait.name: Shared Experience
entries: The clone of Viota can spend 1 minute to perfectly recall an experience that one of her other clones had. She can do this even if that clone has been killed.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The clone of Viota makes two Spectral Pass attacks.

action.name: Spectral Pass
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 5}, reach 5 ft. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d10 + 3}) Force damage.

trait.name: Paranoid
entries: The howler can't be {@status surprised|XPHB}.

trait.name: Sleep-Deprived
entries: The howler has {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on saving throws it makes to avoid or end the {@condition Charmed|XPHB} and {@condition Unconscious|XPHB} conditions.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The howler makes two attacks, using Chomp, Shortsword, or Longbow in any combination. It can forgo one attack to take the Hide action.

action.name: Chomp
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 5}, reach 5 ft. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) Piercing damage.

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 5}, reach 5 ft. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) Bludgeoning damage

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atkr r} {@hit 5}, range 150/600 ft. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) Piercing damage.

reaction.name: Discouraging Chuckle
entries: {@actTrigger} A creature misses the howler with an attack. {@actResponse} The next time the attacker makes an ability check or an attack roll before the end of its next turn, it must subtract {@dice 1d4} from the total.

monster.name: The Hunter
languages: understands Common and Torum but can't speak

trait.name: Heightened Magic Resistance
entries: The Hunter automatically succeeds on saving throws against spells of level 5 or lower, and the attack rolls of such spells automatically miss it; it has {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on saving throws against all other spells and magical effects. Without the Hunter's permission, no spell of level 5 or lower can observe the Hunter remotely or detect its thoughts, creature type, or alignment.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (5/Day)
entries: If the Hunter fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: New Life
entries: When the Hunter dies, a new great beast is born into the world.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Hunter makes three Rend attacks. It can replace one attack with a use of Swallow.

action.name: Rend
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 19}, reach 15 ft. {@h}32 ({@damage 4d10 + 10}) Slashing damage.

action.name: Inspiring Presence (1/Day)
entries: Each creature of the Hunter's choice within 1,000 feet of it gains {@variantrule Heroic Inspiration|XPHB} and 19 ({@dice 3d12}) {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB}.

bonus.name: Swallow
entries: {@actSave dex} {@dc 22}, one creature within 15 feet of the Hunter (it can have up to six creatures swallowed at a time). {@actSaveFail} The target is swallowed by the Hunter. A swallowed creature has the {@condition Blinded|XPHB} and {@condition Restrained|XPHB} conditions, has {@variantrule Cover|XPHB|Total Cover} against attacks and other effects outside the Hunter, and takes 42 ({@damage 12d6}) Acid damage at the start of each of the Hunter's turns.

If the Hunter takes 30 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, the Hunter must succeed on a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, each of which enters an empty space within 10 feet of the Hunter and has the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition. If the Hunter dies, any swallowed creature no longer has the {@condition Restrained|XPHB} condition and can escape from the corpse using 20 feet of movement, exiting {@condition Prone|XPHB}.

reaction.name: Spirit of Obojima (1/Day)
entries: {@actTrigger} The Hunter becomes {@status Bloodied|XPHB}. {@actResponse} The Hunter gains 100 {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} and all harmful spells and effects on it immediately end.

reaction.name: Leap
entries: The dragon frog leaps straight into the air before slamming back down to the ground. {@actSave str} {@dc 22}, each creature in a 30-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} originating from the dragon frog. {@actSaveFail} The target has the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition.

legendary.name: Avian Strike
entries: The Hunter moves up to half its {@variantrule Speed|XPHB}, and it makes one Rend attack.

legendary.name: Barrel Roll
entries: Creatures flying within 30 feet of the Hunter are pushed 15 feet straight away from it. {@actSave str} {@dc 22}, each creature on top of the Hunter. {@actSaveFail} The target is thrown 30 feet away from the Hunter in a random direction.

legendary.name: Thunderous Beak
entries: {@actSave con} {@dc 20}, each creature other than the Hunter within 150 feet (a swallowed creature automatically fails this save). {@actSaveFail} 66 ({@damage 12d10}) Thunder damage, and the target has the {@condition Deafened|XPHB} condition for 24 hours. {@actSaveSuccess} Half damage only. {@actSaveSuccessOrFail} The Hunter can't take this action again until the start of its next turn.

trait.name: Thorn-Covered
entries: When the lion's blume attempts to grapple a creature, the target takes 2 ({@damage 1d4}) Piercing damage whether it avoids the grapple or not. A target {@condition Grappled|XPHB} by the lion's blume takes 2 ({@damage 1d4}) Piercing damage at the start of each of the target's turns.

action.name: Chomp
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 4}, reach 10 ft. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) Piercing damage.

action.name: Perfume Poof
entries: The mossling casts the {@spell Pacify Person|ObojimaTallGrass24} spell, requiring no Material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 11}).

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The kafuka casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 13}, {@hit 5} to hit with spell attacks):

trait.name: Mimicry
entries: The kafuka can mimic animal sounds and Humanoid voices. A creature that hears the sounds can tell they are imitations with a successful {@dc 13} Wisdom ({@skill Insight|XPHB}) check.

trait.name: Speak with Beasts
entries: The kafuka can communicate with Beasts as if they shared a language.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The kafuka makes two Claw attacks. It can replace one attack with a use of Spellcasting to cast {@spell Water Bullet|ObojimaTallGrass24}.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 5}, reach 5 ft. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) Slashing damage.

action.name: Summon Swarm (2/Day)
entries: The kafuka magically calls forth a swarm of woodland creatures in an unoccupied space it can see within 60 feet of it. The swarm uses the {@creature Swarm of Rats|XMM} stat block. It takes its turn immediately after the kafuka on the same {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB} count, and it obeys the kafuka. The swarm disappears after 1 minute or when it takes any damage.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The pixie casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 13}, {@hit 5} to hit with spell attacks):

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The pixie has {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Gift of Flight {@recharge}
entries: The pixie magically grants a creature it can see a {@variantrule Fly Speed|XPHB} of 30 feet. It has this {@variantrule Fly Speed|XPHB}, as long as the pixie is holding its breath. The pixie can hold its breath for up to 1 minute. The pixie can only grant this effect to one creature at a time.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The postal knight makes two attacks, using Frying Pan, Longsword, or Sling in any combination.

action.name: Frying Pan
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 4}, reach 5 ft. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) Bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Longsword
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 4}, reach 10 ft. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) Slashing damage.

action.name: Sling
entries: {@atkr r} {@hit 3}, range 30/120 ft. {@h}6 ({@damage 2d4 + 1}) Bludgeoning damage.

bonus.name: Defensive Cooking
entries: The postal knight gains a +1 bonus to AC until the end of its next turn. It must be wielding a frying pan to take this {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}.

reaction.name: Brother in Arms
entries: {@actTrigger} A friendly creature within 5 feet of the postal knight takes damage. {@actResponse} The postal knight and the target each take half of the damage dealt, splitting the damage between them.

monster.name: Rubble Golem
languages: understands the languages it knew in life but can't speak

trait.name: Immutable Form
entries: The golem can't shape-shift.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The golem has {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The golem makes three Slam attacks. It can replace two attacks with a use of Collapse.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 10}, reach 5 ft. {@h}22 ({@damage 3d10 + 6}) Bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Collapse {@recharge 5}
entries: The golem jumps to a space within 15 feet of itself. {@actSave dex} {@dc 17}, each creature in a 15-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} originating from where the golem lands. {@actSaveFail} 22 ({@damage 5d8}) Bludgeoning damage, and the target has the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition. {@actSaveSuccess} Half damage only.

When the golem lands, it temporarily becomes a pile of rubble. While it is rubble, the golem has the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition and {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to all damage, it automatically fails Dexterity saving throws, and the area within this effect's {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} is {@variantrule Difficult Terrain|XPHB}. At the start of the golem's next turn, these effects end, and the golem reverts to its normal form; any creature in the golem's space is pushed to the nearest unoccupied space within 5 feet of the golem.

trait.name: Amorphous
entries: The elemental can move through a space as narrow as 6 inches wide without expending extra movement to do so.

trait.name: Entangling Form
entries: {@actSave str} {@dc 14}, any Large or smaller creature that starts its turn in a 5-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} originating from the elemental. {@actSaveFail} 5 ({@damage 1d10}) Bludgeoning damage, and the target has the {@condition Grappled|XPHB} condition (escape {@dc 14}). Until the grapple ends, the target has the {@condition Restrained|XPHB} condition, and it takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) Bludgeoning damage at the start of each of its turns.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: If the elemental is motionless at the start of combat, it has {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on its {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB} roll. Moreover, if a creature hasn't observed the elemental move or act, that creature must succeed on a {@dc 18} Intelligence ({@skill Investigation|XPHB}) check to discern that the elemental isn't ordinary seaweed.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The elemental makes two Slam attacks.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 6}, reach 5 ft. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) Bludgeoning damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) Poison damage.

trait.name: Rush
entries: {@actSave str} {@dc 14}, any creature within 5 feet of the sheep dragon when it moves at least 20 feet in a straight line and flies past the creature. {@actSaveFail} The target is pulled 10 feet in the direction the sheep dragon is moving, it has the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition, and the sheep dragon doesn't provoke an {@action Opportunity Attack|XPHB} from it. {@actSaveSuccess} If the target makes an {@action Opportunity Attack|XPHB} against the sheep dragon, it has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on the attack roll.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The sheep dragon makes three attacks, using Chomp, Headbutt, or Wind Pistol in any combination.

action.name: Chomp
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 5}, reach 5 ft. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) Piercing damage.

action.name: Headbutt
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 3}, reach 10 ft. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d12 + 1}) Bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Wind Pistol
entries: {@atkr r} {@hit 5}, range 100/200 ft. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) Bludgeoning damage.

trait.name: Shrapnel
entries: {@actSave wis} {@dc 10}, any creature in a 5-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} originating from the swarm when the swarm takes damage. {@actSaveFail} The target has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on the next attack roll it makes before the end of its next turn.

trait.name: Swarm
entries: The swarm can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a Tiny fish. The swarm can't regain {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} or gain {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB}.

action.name: Chomp
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 4}, reach 5 ft. {@h}16 ({@damage 4d6 + 2}) Piercing damage, or 9 ({@damage 2d6 + 2}) Piercing damage if the swarm is {@status Bloodied|XPHB}.

monster.name: Sky King
languages: understands Common and Torum but can't speak

trait.name: Cloud Trail
entries: Wherever the Sky King flies, it creates a trail of fluffy white clouds in its wake, which last for 1 hour. Their area is {@variantrule Heavily Obscured|XPHB}.

trait.name: Heightened Magic Resistance
entries: The Sky King automatically succeeds on saving throws against spells of level 5 or lower, and the attack rolls of such spells automatically miss it; it has {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on saving throws against all other spells and magical effects. Without the Sky King's permission, no spell of level 5 or lower can observe the Sky King remotely or detect its thoughts, creature type, or alignment.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (5/Day)
entries: If the Sky King fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: New Life
entries: When the Sky King dies, a new great beast is born into the world.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Sky King makes three Rend attacks.

action.name: Rend
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 16}, reach 15 ft. {@h}34 ({@damage 4d12 + 8}) Piercing damage.

action.name: Inspiring Presence (1/Day)
entries: Each creature of the Sky King's choice within 300 feet of it gains {@variantrule Heroic Inspiration|XPHB} and a {@variantrule Fly Speed|XPHB} of 30 feet for 1 minute.

reaction.name: Spirit of Obojima (1/Day)
entries: {@actTrigger} The Sky King becomes {@status Bloodied|XPHB}. {@actResponse} Each creature of the Sky King's choice in a 10-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} originating from it takes 22 ({@damage 4d10}) Lightning damage. This effect repeats at the end of each of the Sky King's turns for 1 minute.

legendary.name: Nullify
entries: The Sky King suppresses one ongoing spell it is aware of within 120 feet of it. The spell remains suppressed until the end of the Sky King's next turn, during which the spell doesn't function, but the time it spends suppressed counts against its duration. The Sky King can't take this action again until the start of its next turn.

legendary.name: Soaring Strike
entries: The Sky King moves up to half its {@variantrule Speed|XPHB}, and it makes one Rend attack.

legendary.name: Turbulent Shift
entries: Structures within 60 feet of the Sky King take 50 Bludgeoning damage, as do objects that aren't being worn or carried. {@actSave str} {@dc 23}, each creature (other than the Sky King) within 60 feet of the Sky King. {@actSaveFail} 56 ({@damage 16d6}) Bludgeoning damage, and the target has the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition and {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on the next {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB} it makes before the end of its next turn. {@actSaveSuccess} Half damage only. {@actSaveSuccessOrFail} The Sky King can't take this action again until the start of its next turn.

monster.name: Jumaga the Sky Salamander
languages: understands Common and Torum but can't speak

trait.name: Color Shift
entries: Jumaga naturally changes color to blend into its environment. Creatures that are more than 300 feet away from Jumaga have {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on Wisdom ({@skill Perception|XPHB}) checks made to see it.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (5/Day)
entries: If Jumaga fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: Jumaga has {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: New Life
entries: When Jumaga dies, a new great beast is born into the world.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Jumaga makes three Rend attacks.

action.name: Rend
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 14}, reach 15 ft. {@h}25 ({@damage 4d8 + 7}) Piercing damage.

action.name: Paralyzing Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: {@actSave con} {@dc 23}, each creature in a 60-foot {@variantrule Cone [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Cone}. {@actSaveFail} The target has the {@condition Paralyzed|XPHB} condition. It repeats the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. After 1 minute, it succeeds automatically.

reaction.name: Spirit of Obojima (1/Day)
entries: {@actTrigger} Jumaga becomes {@status Bloodied|XPHB}. {@actResponse} For 1 minute, Jumaga's Rend attack deals an extra 11 ({@damage 2d10}) Poison damage on a hit, and it regains 5 ({@dice 1d10}) {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} each time it's targeted by a spell of level 5 or lower.

legendary.name: Bestial Hiss
entries: {@actSave wis} {@dc 25}, each creature of Jumaga's choice within 60 feet of it. {@actSaveFail} The target has the {@condition Pacified|ObojimaTallGrass24} condition until the end of its next turn.

legendary.name: Emit Toxins
entries: {@actSave con} {@dc 23}, each creature in a 5-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} originating from Jumaga. {@actSaveFail} 22 ({@damage 4d10}) Poison damage; a creature {@status Concentration|XPHB|Concentrating} on a spell has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on the Constitution saving throw it makes to maintain {@status Concentration|XPHB} as a result of this damage. {@actSaveSuccess} Half damage only. {@actSaveSuccessOrFail} Jumaga can't take this action again until the start of its next turn.

legendary.name: Serpentine Strike
entries: Jumaga moves up to half its {@variantrule Speed|XPHB}, and it makes one Rend attack.

trait.name: Fire Aura
entries: At the end of each of the slagger's turns, each creature of the slagger's choice in a 5-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} originating from the slagger takes 2 ({@damage 1d4}) Fire damage. This damage is doubled if the target is a creature wearing metal armor or wielding metal weapons.

trait.name: Scorch
entries: Flammable objects that are Huge or smaller ignite if the slagger comes within 15 feet of them.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The slagger makes two attacks, using Slam or Spew Magma in any combination.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 7}, reach 5 ft. {@h}18 ({@damage 4d6 + 4}) Bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Spew Magma
entries: {@atkr r} {@hit 8}, range 30/90 ft. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) Fire damage. Regardless of whether the attack hits or misses, the area within 5 feet of the target is covered in lava. The lava is {@variantrule Difficult Terrain|XPHB}, and a creature that starts its turn in the lava takes 4 ({@damage 1d8}) Fire damage. The lava cools and hardens after 1 minute, at which point it becomes harmless and is no longer {@variantrule Difficult Terrain|XPHB}.

bonus.name: Cough
entries: {@actSave con} {@dc 16}, each creature in a 30-foot {@variantrule Cone [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Cone}. {@actSaveFail} 19 ({@damage 3d12}) Poison damage. {@actSaveSuccess} Half damage.

trait.name: Amorphous
entries: The slime can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch without expending extra movement to do so.

action.name: Spike
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 4}, reach 5 ft. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) Piercing damage plus 2 ({@damage 1d4}) Acid damage.

action.name: Flee
entries: The slime chooses a number up to 1 less than its current {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}. It loses that number of {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} and the same number of pieces of the slime split off of itself. The slime then moves up to its {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} as part of this action, and each of the pieces that split off of it each move up to 20 feet in a random direction before becoming inert.

trait.name: Amorphous
entries: The slime can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch without expending extra movement to do so.

trait.name: Repulsive Stench
entries: {@actSave con} {@dc 14}, any creature that starts its turn in a 10-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} originating from the slime. {@actSaveFail} The target must use all of its movement to move as far away from the slime as it can, using the safest route. {@actSaveSuccess} The target is immune to this slime's Repulsive Stench for 24 hours.

trait.name: Sticky
entries: At the start of the slime's turn, if it hasn't moved since the start of its last turn, each space within 5 feet of it becomes slathered in an acrid, yellow coating for 1 minute. The slathered spaces are {@variantrule Difficult Terrain|XPHB} for all creatures except Oozes. {@actSave con} {@dc 14}, any creature that enters a slathered space for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there. (Oozes automatically succeed on this save). {@actSaveFail} 4 ({@damage 1d8}) Acid damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The slime makes two Spike attacks.

action.name: Spike
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 7}, reach 5 ft. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) Piercing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) Acid damage.

bonus.name: Arrange
entries: {@actSave str} {@dc 15}, one creature the slime can see within 5 feet. {@actSaveFail} 4 ({@damage 1d8}) Acid damage, and the target is moved to an unoccupied space of the slime's choice within 10 feet of the slime.

trait.name: Amorphous
entries: The slime can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch without expending extra movement to do so.

trait.name: Explosive
entries: {@actSave dex} {@dc 17}, each creature in a 10-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} originating from the slime whenever it takes Fire damage. {@actSaveFail} The target takes Fire damage equal to the amount dealt to the slime. {@actSaveSuccess} Half damage.

trait.name: Steaming
entries: If water touches the slime, steam erupts from it, filling the area in a 20-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} originating from the slime. The area is {@variantrule Heavily Obscured|XPHB} until the end of the slime's next turn or until a strong wind (such as the {@spell Gust of Wind|XPHB} spell) disperses it. This steam doesn't impede the vision of orange or yellow slimes.

trait.name: Sulfurous Haze
entries: Creatures in a 60-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} originating from the slime take a -5 penalty to ranged attack rolls.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The slime makes two Spike attacks.

action.name: Spike
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 9}, reach 10 ft. {@h}18 ({@damage 3d8 + 5}) Bludgeoning damage plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) Fire damage.

bonus.name: Arrange
entries: {@actSave str} {@dc 17}, one creature the slime can see within 10 feet. {@actSaveFail} 13 ({@damage 3d8}) Fire damage, and the target is moved to an unoccupied space of the slime's choice within 15 feet of the slime.

trait.name: Amorphous
entries: The slime can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch without expending extra movement to do so.

trait.name: Sickness
entries: {@actSave con} {@dc 13}, any creature that starts its turn in a 5-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} originating from the slime. {@actSaveFail} The target gains 1 {@condition Exhaustion|XPHB} level. It is then immune to the Sickness of all corrupted slimes for 24 hours.

action.name: Spike
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 5}, reach 5 ft. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) Piercing damage plus 4 ({@damage 1d8}) Necrotic damage.

action.name: Drain
entries: The slime deals 4 ({@damage 1d8}) Necrotic damage to each creature in a 120-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} originating from it that has failed a saving throw against this slime's Sickness in the past 24 hours. The slime then regains a number of {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to the damage dealt.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: If the slime is motionless at the start of combat, it has {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on its {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB} roll. Moreover, if a creature hasn't observed the slime move or act, that creature must succeed on a {@dc 18} Intelligence ({@skill Investigation|XPHB}) check to discern that the slime isn't an ordinary soda can.

trait.name: Soda Pop
entries: {@actSave dex} {@dc 10}, each creature in a 10-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} originating from the slime when the slime is reduced to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}. {@actSaveFail} 4 ({@damage 1d6 + 1}) Force damage.

action.name: Pseudopod
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 3}, reach 5 ft. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d6 + 1}) Bludgeoning damage plus 4 ({@damage 1d8}) Poison damage.

bonus.name: Adhere
entries: {@actSave str} {@dc 10}, a creature within 5 feet. {@actSaveFail} The slime attaches to the target. If the target is Medium or smaller, as long as the slime is attached, the target's {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} is halved, and it has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on Dexterity checks and Dexterity saving throws.

While attached to a target, the slime's {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} becomes 0, it can't benefit from any bonus to its {@variantrule Speed|XPHB}, and it moves with the target. A creature within reach can take an action to try to detach the slime from the target, doing so with a successful {@dc 13} Strength ({@skill Athletics|XPHB}) check. On its turn, the slime can detach itself by using 5 feet of movement.

reaction.name: Lash
entries: {@actTrigger} An enemy provokes an {@action Opportunity Attack|XPHB} from the slime. {@actResponse} {@actSave dex} {@dc 12}, the triggering creature. {@actSaveFail} The target has the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition.

trait.name: Promising Threat
entries: The spirit has {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on Charisma ({@skill Intimidation|XPHB}) checks if the target has seen it hit a creature with its Chomp attack in the past minute.

action.name: Chomp
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 5}, reach 5 ft. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) Piercing damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it has the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition.

reaction.name: Devour
entries: {@actTrigger} The spirit reduces a creature to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}. {@actResponse} The spirit regains 5 ({@dice 1d10}) {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}.

trait.name: Snowball
entries: Whenever the snowball spirits take the {@action Dash|XPHB} action, they can make a Slam attack as part of that action. Alternatively, if the snowball spirits are in snowy terrain, they can choose to absorb the snow during the movement, regaining 10 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} and increasing in size by one category—from Medium to Large, for example.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The snowball spirits make three Pelt attacks.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 5}, reach 5 ft. {@h}25 ({@damage 4d10 + 3}) Bludgeoning damage. If the target is at least one size smaller than the snowball spirits, it is pulled into their space and engulfed by them, carrying the target with the snowball spirits as they move. An engulfed creature has the {@condition Grappled|XPHB} condition (escape {@dc 14}) and {@variantrule Cover|XPHB|Three-Quarters Cover}, and it has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on attack rolls against the snowball spirits. A creature within 5 feet of the spirits can pull an engulfed creature out of them by taking an action to make a {@dc 14} Strength ({@skill Athletics|XPHB}) check, freeing the creature on a success. The snowball spirits can have no more than one creature that is one size smaller than them engulfed at a time, or up to three creatures that are at least two sizes smaller than them.

action.name: Pelt
entries: {@atkr r} {@hit 5}, range 20/40 ft. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) Bludgeoning damage.

trait.name: Earth Aquatic
entries: The stone whale can move through stone and earth as if they were {@variantrule Difficult Terrain|XPHB}.

trait.name: Hold Breath
entries: The stone whale can hold its breath for 30 minutes.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The stone whale makes two Chomp attacks.

action.name: Chomp
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 8}, reach 5 ft. {@h}18 ({@damage 3d8 + 5}) Bludgeoning damage.

trait.name: Hallucinatory Chatter
entries: {@actSave wis} {@dc 12}, any creature that starts its turn within 30 feet. {@actSaveFail} The target has the {@condition Charmed|XPHB} condition and repeats the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. After 1 minute, it succeeds automatically. The condition ends if the target takes damage or a creature within 5 feet of it takes an action to shake it out of its stupor.

action.name: Chomp
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 5}, reach 5 ft. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d8 + 3}) Piercing damage plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) Poison damage.

bonus.name: Beckon
entries: The stul commands any number of creatures affected by its Hallucinatory Chatter to approach it. Each target spends its next turn moving toward the stul by the most direct route, ending its turn if it gets within 5 feet of the stul.

bonus.name: Mental Invasion
entries: {@actSave wis} {@dc 12}, one creature within 60 feet. {@actSaveFail} The target must immediately use its {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB}, if available, to move as far away from the stul as it can, using the safest route.

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries: The urugama can move through other creatures and objects as if they were {@variantrule Difficult Terrain|XPHB}. It takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) Force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

trait.name: Severed Body
entries: The urugama has four spectral bodies, each of which the urugama can take actions from. These different bodies can't move more than 100 feet away from each other, and the urugama divides its movement among its four bodies as it chooses.

trait.name: Shifting Form
entries: At the start of each of the urugama's turns, one of its bodies is randomly selected as the true urugama. Only the true body can take damage or suffer effects that round. The other bodies can still be targeted with attacks and effects, but they are unaffected, as the attacks and effects harmlessly pass through them.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Each of the urugama's bodies make one Spectral Pass attack.

action.name: Spectral Pass
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 7}, reach 5 ft. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) Necrotic damage.

action.name: Haunting Chuckle
entries: {@actSave wis} {@dc 13}, each creature within 30 feet of any of the urugama's bodies. {@actSaveFail} The target gains 1 {@condition Exhaustion|XPHB} level and is immune to the urugama's Haunting Chuckle for 24 hours.

spellcasting.name: Master's Voice
headerEntries: The vespoma casts the {@spell Command|XPHB} spell, using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 12}). This save DC increases by 1 for each additional vespoma within 30 feet of it (maximum {@dc 20}).

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The vespoma makes one Chomp attack and one Claw attack.

action.name: Chomp
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 4}, reach 5 ft. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) Piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 4}, reach 5 ft. {@h}7 ({@damage 2d4 + 2}) Slashing damage.

trait.name: Flammable
entries: The vile corruption is able to be ignited as if it were a flammable object. {@actSave dex} {@dc 14}, each creature in a 20-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} originating from the vile corruption when it takes 20 or more Fire damage from a single attack or effect, or at the start of each of its turns once it has been on fire for at least three rounds. {@actSaveFail} 35 ({@damage 10d6}) Fire damage. {@actSaveSuccess} Half damage.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The vile corruption has {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The vile corruption makes one Chomp attack and two Claw attacks.

action.name: Chomp
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 7}, reach 5 ft. {@h}20 ({@damage 3d10 + 4}) Piercing damage, and if the target is a creature, putrid water is injected into it. Any ongoing effects from potions affecting the target end on it.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 7}, reach 5 ft. {@h}17 ({@damage 3d8 + 4}) Slashing damage.

action.name: Avian Mimicry
entries: Watery songbirds burst from the vile corruption. {@actSave dex} {@dc 15}, up to three creatures within 30 feet. {@actSaveFail} 16 ({@damage 3d10}) Necrotic damage. {@actSaveSuccess} Half damage.

bonus.name: Shape-Shift
entries: The vile corruption shape-shifts to resemble a watery version of a Huge or smaller Beast, Demon, Elemental, Monstrosity, or Spirit of its choice, or it returns to its true form. Its statistics are the same in each form, except for its size.

monster.name: Wandering Door
languages: understands all languages but can't speak

trait.name: Doorway
entries: A creature that enters the wandering door can teleport to any doorway it chooses on any plane of existence as if the doorway was planted directly in front of the location. If a creature is not aware of how the door's magic works, it is instead teleported to a random doorway.

trait.name: Immutable Form
entries: The wandering door can't shape-shift.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (7/Day)
entries: If the wandering door fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Like the Wind
entries: The wandering door doesn't provoke {@action Opportunity Attack|XPHB|Opportunity Attacks} when it moves out of an enemy's reach.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The wandering door has {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Special Feet
entries: The wandering door can stand on and move across any surface, including vertically up walls and on top of liquids.

action.name: Leap
entries: The wandering door leaps 60 feet vertically into the air.

action.name: Shake
entries: {@actSave str} {@dc 19}, each creature on top of the wandering door. {@actSaveFail} The target is thrown 10 feet away from the door in a random direction and has the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition.

reaction.name: Flee
entries: {@actTrigger} A creature moves within 30 feet of the wandering door. {@actResponse} The wandering door moves up to half its {@variantrule Speed|XPHB}.

reaction.name: Shudder
entries: {@actTrigger} A creature lands on top of the wandering door. {@actResponse} The wandering door uses its Shake action.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: If the watchwood tree is motionless at the start of combat, it has {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on its {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB} roll. Moreover, if a creature hasn't observed the watchwood tree move or act, that creature must succeed on a {@dc 18} Intelligence ({@skill Investigation|XPHB}) check to discern that the watchwood tree isn't an ordinary tree.

trait.name: Unruly Earth
entries: The ground in a 15-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} originating from the watchwood tree is {@variantrule Difficult Terrain|XPHB} for all creatures except watchwood trees.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 4}, reach 15 ft. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d6 + 2}) Bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Watching Eye {@recharge}
entries: {@actSave wis} {@dc 12}, each creature of the watchwood tree's choice in a 15-foot {@variantrule Cone [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Cone}. {@actSaveFail} The target has the {@condition Frightened|XPHB} condition. The watchwood tree can then immediately make a Slam attack against each {@condition Frightened|XPHB} target. The target repeats the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. After 1 minute, it succeeds automatically.
Failure by 5 or More: The target also has the {@condition Restrained|XPHB} condition until it no longer has the {@condition Frightened|XPHB} condition.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The witch casts one of the following spells, using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 12}, {@hit 4} to hit with spell attacks).

trait.name: Coven Member
entries: The witch has {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on Charisma ({@skill Persuasion|XPHB}) checks involving a witch coven.

action.name: Unarmed Strike
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 2}, reach 5 ft. {@h}1 Bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Drum Mallet
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 4} (+6 if the target has been hit by another Drum Mallet since the end of this yokario's last turn), reach 5 ft. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) Bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Sling
entries: {@atkr r} {@hit 4}, range 30/120 ft. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) Bludgeoning damage.

trait.name: Heat Consumption
entries: A creature that starts its turn within 5 feet of the cuddle bug gains 1 Freeze Point, affecting the target as detailed below.

rows: The creature takes a -2 penalty to {@action Attack|XPHB} rolls.
The creature can't add its {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus} to any Dexterity checks or Dexterity saving throws it makes.
The creature gains 1 {@condition Exhaustion|XPHB} level. This level of {@condition Exhaustion|XPHB} goes away when the creature no longer has any Freeze Points.
The creature's {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} is halved, and it can take either an action or a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} on each of its turns, not both.
At the start of each of the creature's turns while it doesn't have the {@condition Unconscious|XPHB} condition, it takes 5 Cold damage.

entries: A creature's accumulated Freeze Points are lost if it takes any Fire damage or if it finishes a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

action.name: Drain Heat
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 3}, reach 5 ft. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d6 + 1}) Cold damage, and the cuddle bug regains {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to half the damage dealt.

variant.name: Here is a list of abilities a Spirit can have
entries: Below is a list of abilities a spirit can have; some of these abilities may increase the spirit's {@variantrule Challenge Rating|XPHB}:

items.name: Commune with Animals
entries: The spirit can communicate with Beasts as if they shared a language.

items.name: Ethereal Sight
entries: The spirit can see 60 feet into the Spirit Realm (Ethereal Plane) when it is on the Physical Realm and vice versa.

items.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries: The spirit can move through other creatures and objects as if they were {@variantrule Difficult Terrain|XPHB}. It takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) Force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

items.name: Invisible
entries: The spirit always has the {@condition Invisible|XPHB} condition.

items.name: Magical
entries: The spirit knows two cantrips and has one level 1 spell prepared, which it can cast at will, requiring no Material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 12}, {@hit 4} to hit with spell attacks).

items.name: Ocular Prowess
entries: The spirit has {@sense Truesight|XPHB} with a range of 30 feet.

items.name: Action: Spirit Shift
entries: The spirit enters the Spirit Realm (Ethereal Plane) from the Physical Realm, or vice versa.

items.name: Action: Spectral Pass
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 2}, reach 5 ft. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d8}) Force damage.

spellcasting.name: Telekinetic Reach
headerEntries: The spirit casts the {@spell Mage Hand|XPHB} spell, using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability. When it does so, the spectral hand is {@condition Invisible|XPHB}.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: If the spirit is motionless at the start of combat, it has {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on its {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB} roll. Moreover, if a creature hasn't observed the spirit move or act, that creature must succeed on a {@dc 18} Intelligence ({@skill Investigation|XPHB}) check to discern that the spirit isn't an object.

trait.name: New Form (1/Day)
entries: When the spirit is reduced to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} but not killed outright, it can choose a different object it can see within 10 feet of it and send its consciousness into that object. After it does so, it drops to 1 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} instead.

trait.name: Body Bite (1/Day)
entries: While the spirit has at least 5 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, a friendly creature can take a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to consume a piece of the spirit. The spirit takes 2 ({@damage 1d4}) Piercing damage, and the creature regains a number of {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to the damage taken.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The spirit regains 2 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} at the start of each of its turns if it has at least 1 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point}.

action.name: Slam

The spirit takes 7 ({@damage 3d4}) Piercing damage, and the creature regains a number of {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to the damage taken.
